loans.name: Mwengi

texts.en:
Mwengi lives in Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. 

He runs a motorcycle business, transporting people and goods. The business has been operating for three years. He employs one person in the business.

Mwengi learnt about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group, and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge he is facing is the high cost of servicing.

Mwengi is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenyan shillings to service the motorcycle. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. His plan for the future is to buy a vehicle for use in light transport.

loans.use: To service the motorcycle.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, all of whom attend school. She is also looking after three nephews who are orphans.
She has been keeping poultry for two years, working seven days a week. She also sells plastic plates, cups, buckets, basins, and food containers to earn extra income. 

She has requested a loan of UShs 2,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to procure chicks and feed. Her challenges include seasonality and diseases. Her dream is to expand her farm by putting up other chicken houses and to accumulate profits that will enable her to build rental houses. She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on loans. She lives in her house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and water.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Susie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Susie is 42 years old and has one child who is in school.

Susie has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock like laundry soap, shampoo, cooking oil, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.

Susie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Susie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like laundry soap, shampoo, cooking oil, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a charcoal seller and has been doing this business for three years. Zipporah is a married mother of two school-going children.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase a new stock of charcoal. She will pay for her children’s school fees from the extra income. 

Despite the challenge of inflation, Zipporah believes the business has a future and besides, she is getting the income to educate her children, She looks forward to owning a wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: To purchase a new stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is 50 years old, married with two children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a food vending business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2005, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional food to sell. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her business and her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional food to sell

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai was born in 1987. She has three children who are little. Mai has a small carpentry workshop at home. She makes 4,000,000 VND a month. She has done this job for 3 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 
She started to partner with SEDA this year. In this first loan, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. Her dream is to empower her children to have good careers.
	Other members which are part of Mai's group include the following: 
	 Luyen was born in 1987. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. 
	 Thinh was born in 1993. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. 
	 Lap was born in 1985. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. 
      Loan was born in 1987. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to sell groceries.
	 Do was born in 1963. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a 47-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children. The oldest child is 20, while the youngest is 3. She is engaged in a fishing business. She sells fish, shrimp, crabs, and sea shells. She has been fishing for  almost 20 years. Her husband catches the fish, while Jocelyn sells his catch. Jocelyn works hard to earn a living. Jocelyn requested  a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fishing net, nylon, and a weight lifter. In the future, Jocelyn would like to expand her business to support her family and also to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, nylon, and a weight lifter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an electric grinder, baking tins, pots, a stove, and a tank of gas.

loans.name: José Efraín

texts.es:
José tiene 31 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Tiene varios años dedicándose  a realizar trabajos agrícolas; oficio que aprendió de su padre. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. junto a su compañera de vida, para prepararse e irse al terreno en donde tiene sus cultivos durante toda la mañana y por la tarde trabaja como jornalero y sus hijos se marchan para la escuela.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar semilla, fertilizantes y pesticidas. Para cultivar en el tiempo indicado y con los insumos suficientes para que la cosecha sea muy productiva y pueda obtener ingresos que le permita mantener a su familia y continuar ayudando a sus hijos para que estudien. Su propósito, es instalar una tienda para tener otra fuente de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José is 31 and has a common-law wife and three children.  For a number of years he has been earning his living in agriculture, which he learned from his father.  He and his life-partner get up at 4AM to get ready to spend all morning in their crop fields.  In the afternoon José works as a day-laborer and his kids go off to school.  

The loan José is seeking from Fundación Campo is to buy seasonal seed, fertilizer, and pesticides.  With the supplies he needs for a fruitful harvest he can earn income to support his family and continue helping his children get an education.  His intention is to open up a shop as another source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal seed, fertilizers, and pesticides, so he'll have sufficient supplies for a very fruitful harvest.

loans.name: Anorlyne

texts.en:
Anorlyne lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three children. 

Anorlyne owns a grocery store, a business which she has been operating for four years.
 
She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations.

Her main challenge is the perishability of food.

Anorlyne is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy food stock like cabbages, kales, onions etc. She will use the extra from the loan to improve the living standard of her family, and especially for education.

loans.use: To buy food stock like cabbages, kales, onions, etc.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in rice farming for more than 13 years now. Angelita works hard to support her husband in tilling their farm. 

Angelita is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. She dreams of expanding their farming business and making it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Zenita

texts.en:
Zenita is married with two children. She is 47 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Zenita is operating a service-based business,providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years and every month she earns 3.000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

Zenita has been a member of GDMPC for 5 years. In the future, Zenita hopes to see her children finish their studies and to gain double income from her business.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two school going children. She owns a grocery shop, a business which she has been running for twelve years. Her business sells foodstuff like maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.
Furaha learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is inflation. 
Furaha is applying for a loan of 107,300 Kenya shillings to buy grocery stock like maize, beans, rice and cooking fat. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family, set up other types of businesses and pay school fees for her children. She aspires to open a mini wholesale.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock such as maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children and six of them attend school.
She has been operating a hardware shop for the last twenty-five years, working seven days a week. She generates additional income from a beauty salon.
She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to increase her stock with more brushes, cardboard, nails, paint, thinner, hoes, knives and cement to sell as well as hair and body oils for her salon. Her challenges include seasonality and thieves. Her dream is to own a fully stocked hard ware shop as well as cattle. She joined MCDT because of the good customer care exhibited by staff members. She stays in her husband`s house with access to electricity but has no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy brushes, paint,thinner, bags of cement, knives, nails and cardboard to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in the Likoni area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a married businessman and owns a transport business which he has been operating for four years. He offers transport service to the residents of Likoni.

David learnt about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve business operations. The challenges he is facing are police harassment and an unpredictable business climate, especially during the rainy seasons. He therefore would like to set up another business besides the transport.

David is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to buy a stock of charcoal. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. His plan for the future is to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Pola

texts.en:
Pola, aged 54 years, is married with seven children, three of whom attend school while four are over-age and do not attend school.  Her husband is a businessman and he supports his family financially. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Pola operates a food stall business, buying and selling maize at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize for resale. She dreams of expanding to her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Emmanuel Kepa

texts.en:
Emmanuel Kepa is a 45-year-old businessman who lives in Nimule. He is married with five children between the ages of 5 and 15. All of them go to school.

Emmanuel Kepa runs a general store and has been in business for five years. He has no employee. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 3000 SSP to purchase more sandals, phone covers, and many other items.  In addition to this business he  has no other source of Income.

In five years Emmanuel Kepa   would like to expand his business and open other branches. His   major challenges include high market prices and high transportation cost.

Emmanuel Kepa says he is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like sandals, phone covers, etc

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman. She has five children ranging from 10 to 26 years old. She describes herself as innovative and a risk taker. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with plenty of customers and her primary customers are locals. The challenge she faces is that most of the vegetables and fruits are perishable.

She wants to have a stable business in five years. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has seven children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a fruit and coconuts selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Jingke

texts.en:
Jingke is a 25-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children. The oldest child is 6 and the youngest is 2. 

She is engaged in fishing and selling fish. She has been in this business for eight years. Her husband is a fisherman. He is the one who catches the fish and Jingke sells the catch. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like nylon, floater and weight lifter. In the future, Jingke would like to expand her business to support her family and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like nylon, floater and weight lifter.

loans.name: Chaplain Laka

texts.en:
Chaplain Laka is a 46 yrs old business man who lives in Nimule, he is married with 5 children between the age 5 and 18. All of them go to school. Chaplain Laka runs a general store, and has been in this business for 8 years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions of loan officers. He is taking a loan of 3000 SSP to purchase more maize flour among other things.
In 5 years, Chaplain Laka would like to expand his business and open other branches.
His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation cost.
Chaplain says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of kiva.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 43 years old, married and a mother of seven children. She operates a housing business where by she rents rooms in Malindi for a living. She earns a monthly income of about KES 15,000. 

She has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 to repair, renovate and paint her rental rooms so as to have them have a better look. 

Esther intends to continue growing her business so as to enable her family to continue being financially stable.

loans.use: To cater for repairs and painting of her rental rooms

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 41-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 4 years to 12 years. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, flour, salt, cooking oil and other items. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to his stock of sugar, flour, salt, cooking oil and other items. He also does farming to supplement his income. His business goal is to own a wholesale store within five years.

loans.use: to add to his stock of sugar, flour, salt, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Khorn is 27 years old, married and blessed with one kid. She permanently lives with her family in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham. Her business location is close to her home. She has been operating farming for almost 10 years. It has been the main source of her income, which enables her to cover the daily food expenses. 

Khorn wants to make a consistent income and serve her family with basic necessities, and therefore, she became engaged in another supplementary businesses after the harvest season. She is really thankful for the little success she has already experienced. 

With this amount for which she has applied, Khorn will use this loan to add to her own capital to buy a piece of farmland. She hopes that the farm ouputs from her rice farming business will be increased and she can provide for all of the household needs.

loans.use: to buy a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Arlyn has been in the business for more than two years now. This is the source of her income. 

Arlyn is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. Through this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. 

In the future, Arlyn dreams of making her business a success and sustainable. Also, she wants to continue supporting the schooling of her children so that they will be able to attain a better education.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Blanca Yaneth

texts.es: Blanca habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. sus negocios estan ubicados en su casa de habitación. Blanca es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora y responsable, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio de crianza de pollos para la compra de concentrado y vitaminas para pollos de engorde. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de aumentar sus ventas e ingresos. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca lives in her own house with her husband and children.  She makes a living in agriculture and in making and selling clothing items.  Her businesses are located in her home.  Blanca is an incredible and very exemplary woman, since she is very hardworking and responsible.  She has made a living in these activities for many years; she has a lot of experience and above all, a set of fixed clients that prefer her more and more every day.

She has made the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL in order to invest in her small business of raising chickens.  She will buy feed and vitamins in order to fatten the chickens.  All of this she does with the final goal of growing her sales and income.  

She hopes to achieve her objective and to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for chickens in order to fatten them.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 34 years old and married. She has one child who is currently in school. Roselyn works very hard.

Roselyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like shampoo, noodles, snack foods, canned goods and other groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like shampoo, noodles, snack foods, canned goods and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a happy business women, especially after witnessing the growth in her business as a result of the funding she received through Milango. She would like to increase the volume of business she handles and is therefore applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to increase the till money/float in her mobile money transfer business.

loans.use: To increase the till money/float in her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and a mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

She has operated a groundnuts vending business for the past two years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of groundnuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Tuyen's Group

texts.en:
Tuyen was born in 1988. She has two children who are little. Tuyen raises chickens and has a small carpentry workshop at home. She earns 5,000,000 VND a month. She has done these jobs for 3 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy food for her chickens and buy wood for her carpentry workshop. Her dream is to empower her to children have good careers.
	Other members which are part of Tuyen's group include the following: 
	 Nam was born in 1984. She wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy food for her chickens and pigs. 
	 Loi was born in 1983. She wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy food for her pigs.
	 Luyen was born in 1979. She wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. 
      Duyen was born in 1979. She wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to sell poultry in the market.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens and buy wood for her carpentry shop.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a married father of four school going children and owns a cafe which he has been operating for five years. He employs three other people at the café.
He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to a group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are competition and the effect of seasonal changes. 
Albert is applying for a loan of 52,250 Kenya shillings to buy food stock such as rice, cereals, wheat flour and cooking oil and pay school fees for his children. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his children and improve their living standard. His dream is to open another food cafe.

loans.use: To buy food stock and pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Illumenada

texts.en: Illumenada is from Misamis Oddicental, Philippines. She is 59 years old, married and has 6 children. To make a living, Illumenada owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. Illumenada has been operating her business for 3 years and earns PHP 3,000 a month from these activities. Illumenada is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000, which will be used to purchase spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle. In 2011, Illumenada joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Flor De Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña flor se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maiz y frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Doña flor esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y tambien para mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografia que es donde siembra y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en:
Flor has worked in agriculture for several years. This has given her the ability and the knowledge she requires to look after her crops. She mainly sows maize and beans. She sells her crops to agencies in her locality that deal in staple grains. The money she makes from these sales helps with her family’s bills. She lives with her husband and two children. 

Flor is requesting a loan in order to buy agricultural supplies, such as manure, seeds and fertilisers, for use when sowing her crops, and also to improve the land she sows, which can be seen in the photo. She hopes that this will increase her earnings and in that way she can continue to contribute to the household bills without difficulty.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and fertilisers, and to improve her land

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan, 58, is married and lives with his family in a rural area located in the Bovel district of Battambang province. He is the father of three kids. He earns a living by growing cassava, as he has been doing for 13 years. Altogether, he can earn about KHR 47,000 per day from his current business, and he is able to save about KHR 20,000 each day for the future. This is Chan’s first loan from VisionFund.  He is applying for a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for his cassava. This loan will enable him to extend his farmland and increase his rice-farming, to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for his cassava farm.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman, 23 years old; she has one kid, who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and medical bills. Beatrice operates a fruit- and vegetable-selling stall at the market, selling to town residents and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of business. With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to buy sacks of fruits and oranges, and bananas and green vegetables, for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and oranges, and bananas and green vegetables, for resale.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. She has two children and has been doing this work for three years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business. She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “milking her cows.” Her biggest challenge is “controlling animal pests and diseases .” Animals on the farm are called “tuimet.” Celestine was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: “they have agricultural training.”  This client was also asked what she learned during Juhudi’s required micro-finance training session: “dairy keeping.” Her highest monthly expense is for farming costs. When asked “How will this loan benefit her family?”, Celestine replied “I will get more milk for my family.” As part of Juhudi’s loan appraisal process, each borrower’s assets are evaluated. Celestine owns the following: “cow, poultry, motorcycle” but does not own “pig, pump, bicycle, automobile.” Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: “mosquito net, solar power, TV, DVD” but does not have “electricity, running water, sewing machine.”		

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is single and has two children who attend school.  She is also looking after two nieces. She lives in Kampala, Uganda. Justine has been selling charcoal in the market at retail for 10 years, working seven days a week. She earns additional income selling Irish potatoes.

Justine is requesting a loan from MCDT SACCO for 700,000 UGX, which she will use to purchase more bags of charcoal. Her challenges include unstable supplies. Her dream is to accumulate enough profits to enable her to become a wholesaler and acquire her own premises.  Justine rents a house with no access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet, 35, is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is for food for the family. For over five years, she has operated a food stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Juliet dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. With the loan that she is requesting, of KES 20,000, she wants to buy supplies of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies of wheat flour, maize flour and beans for her food stall.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 23-year-old married woman. She has two children, 4 and 6 years old. She operates a retail store, where she sells cereals. She has been engaged in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are local. She states that her biggest business challenge is inadequate finances. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more cereals to sell. Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell.

loans.name: Chaplain Yobak

texts.en:
Chaplain Yobak is a 35-year-old business man who lives in Nimule. He is married with three children between the ages of three and twelve. All of them go to school. Chaplain Yobak runs a general store, and he has been in business for five years. He has no employees.

Chaplain Yobak heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 3,000 SSP to purchase more batteries, phone covers, and other items. This business is his only source of income.

In five years, Chaplain Yobak would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. He says he is happy for the loans given by finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like batteries, gloves, and phone chargers for sale.

loans.name: Fienbi

texts.en:
Fienbi is married with six children. The family lives in a three bedroom apartment house in Bamenda in the Northwest Province of Cameroon. Fienbi has faced many challenges in life, including sickness in her family and the deaths of family members, particularly her father and brother, and of friends. The costs of medicines for the sick and funeral costs have left her with inadequate capital to run her business.

With the loan requested, Fienbi will expand her production of yogurt by buying more milk and sugar. She will also buy food items for her shop like beans, maize, palm oil, groundnuts, and rice. She is very positive that her business will succeed because she has been doing it for a long time and is knowledgeable about the business. She has a good business location and regular customers who buy from her shop. At times, she also delivers her yogurt to schools and sells to students. Fienbi's business provides food stuffs to her community at a moderate price and allows them to obtain food without traveling long distances.

With the profit from the loan, Fienbi will expand her business, help the needy in the community, and pay for her children's medication, feeding, and education expenses. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals

loans.use: to buy milk, palm oil, sugar, beans, rice, and maize.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has seven children aged 22 to 33 years. She describes herself as an honest woman. 

Grace operates a retail store where she sells cereals such as maize. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located within a viable, fast-growing town, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of maize. 

Grace will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy cereals to sell. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. Her business goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Ludwina

texts.en: Ludwina is a 46 year old  married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 6 children. She is a fisherwoman. She sells clams, sea shells, shrimp and fish. Ludwina sells her husband's catch to the nearby community. In order to aid her fishing related activities, Ludwina  requested a loan of  6,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fishing and crab nets, to increase the volume of the catch. In the future, Ludwina would like to expand her business to improve their  family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing and crab nets

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you David, a staff member at a sugar company in Magburaka. Through partnering with local companies, SMT is able to provide borrowers like David with micro loans that are repaid through payroll deduction.

David is a 46-year-old man who is married and has nine children. Five of his children attend primary school, two attend secondary school, and the two eldest are now adults. David has been working at the sugar company for nine years. In addition to his work at the company, he has also been a farmer for all that time. 

David has requested a loan of 1,900,000 SLL to hire labor and purchase agricultural seeds to plant in his farm.

loans.use: to hire labor and purchase agricultural seeds to plant in his farm.

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi characterizes herself as a hardworking and enterprising person who has worked since she was very young and is up to any challenge.

Mnyazi runs a pub. The pub is well-stocked and brings in many customers. Because of her store, Mnyazi is able to help her family and has improved her house a lot.

She is now seeking another Kiva loan to buy drinks such as pop, wine, beer, and energy drinks so that she has a wide variety of stock in the pub.

loans.use: to buy more storage containers for her business.

loans.name: Claudia Karina

texts.es: claudia vive con su hijo en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda como. refrescos, granos basicos, aceite, cafe, azucar, etc. asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Claudia lives with her child in her own home. She has a store where she sells basic necessities such as beans, milk, eggs and bread, among other things. She has been running her business for many years, and this has given her experience in sales, which allows her to make the best earnings. 

Her store is located in her home, and it is well-known by the neighbours in the area. She has a large customer base so she keeps the shop well-stocked. She wants to expand her business and make a new investment into it, but she needs capital to do this. For this reason, she is asking for a loan to allow her to buy necessary items for her store, like soft drinks, bulk grains, oil, coffee, sugar, etc. She promises that she will pay off the debt and also says that it will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, oil, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maa Brundabati Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Brundabati Self Help Group is a group made up of 10 members which are all women living in the same neighborhood. Rubi, the leader of the group, is a 39-year-old lady living with her husband and her son in a small village of Khurda district.

Rubi owns and manages a dairy farm where she has 2 cows; she sells 5 litres of milk per day and earns 3,000 Indian Rupees (INR) per month. She wants to purchase 2 new Jersey cows for her farm as demand for cow's milk is more in the village. She also has a plan to repair her cattle shed and make it big.

She along with her group members has requested a loan amount of 300,000 INR.

In the future she wants to increase her farm and sell more milk products like yogurt, butter etc. She has a dream to give a quality life to her family and save some money for her son's future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing two new Jersey cows and for renovating the cattle shed

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 42-year-old woman who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, one daughter and a son. Her son is one year old while her daughter's age is 10 years; she is studying in the 5th class. Rukhsana's husband works at a boutique shop, but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses.

Rukhsana is a very hardworking and independent woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet the family's needs and her children's education expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past five years, and her clients always appreciate her work.

Rukhsana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently in the future. As she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams of building her own house. She also desires to increase her business and to provide a quality education to her children. Rukhsana and her family are very much thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a happy business man. Owing to the last trading season, his business is on the rise, and Joseph has had extra income from the transmission of league matches. 

Joseph would like to diversify his sources of income since the entertainment business is highly seasonal. He therefore intends to set up an accessories shop. He is applying for a loan of 41,850 KES to buy items like basins, cooking utensils, and combs for sale. He believes this will supplement his current business and offer a steady source of income.

loans.use: to buy basins, cooking utensils, and combs for sale.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo, 54, is married and has been blessed with seven children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She cites food as her greatest monthly expense. 

Kadzo has operated a business selling liquor at the market to people in her community. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to diversify into fish sales. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a single business lady and runs a clothes shop which has been operating for two years.   

Juliana was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 21,050 KES to purchase new clothes for sale.

Juliana believes she can save the extra income from this loan and finally buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 30 years old, married and has two children who are in school. He has been in the clothes business in Nakuru for the past five years. 

He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him purchase more stock of clothes for sale. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a fellow client. With the anticipated profit, he hopes to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to open a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jackson Obote

texts.en:
Jackson Obote is a 35-year-old businessman who lives in Nimule. He is married with three children between the ages of three and 12. All of them go to school. Jackson Obote runs a general store, and has been in business for five years. He has no employees. 

He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions done by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 3,000 SSP to purchase more small bags, phone covers and many other items to sell. Aside from this business, he has no other source of income.

In five years Jackson Obote would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. Jackson Obote says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like small bags and mirrors.

loans.name: Alberto De Jesus

texts.es: Don alberto vive con su esposa y su hija en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años con las ventas que realiza de sus granos basicos logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar, el solicita un credito que le permita comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbisidas, foliares y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografia para seguir con sus cosechas para poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en: Alberto lives with his wife and his daughter in his own house. He has been a farmer for many years, and by selling his basic grains he succeeds in paying for his household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy manure, pesticides, weed-killers and foliage fertilizers: he wants to improve the land you can see at his back in picture in order to keep on planting his crops and to consequently earn a better income to offer a better standard of living to his family.

loans.use: To buy manure, pesticides, weed-killers and foliage fertilizers.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Don rigoberto de 52 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa y sus 2 hijo. Él se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace 32 años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografia. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, 52 years old, lives in his own home with his wife and their two children. He has worked growing corn and beans for 32 years. This is how he makes a living and is able to support his household. He grows a harvest every year, and it is the only way he knows how to make a living. He is a very hardworking, honorable and responsible man. Despite his living conditions, which are very humble, he doesn't tire of working and of providing the very best for his family. 

He decided to apply for a loan to buy key agricultural inputs: manure, poisons against pests, seeds, etc, and to improve the land where he plants his crops. His land is the land shown in the photograph. He hopes to have good results since he has no other sources of income. He trusts in God that he will manage to have an abundant harvest, which will allow him to continue supporting his household.

loans.use: to improve his land and buy agricultural inputs like manure, fertilizer, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en: Yahya is a very responsible and hardworking man. He lives with his four children in Ibb, Yemen. He is an employee getting a low salary, which is not enough to cover household expenses. He also has a bus with which to earn daily income, to improve his living standards. He is requesting the loan so he can purchase a washing machine, television and fridge. He hopes to provide his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine, television and fridge.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and four children. Three of his children are still attending school, and one is working. 

Mahmoud owns land, where he cultivates all kinds of fruits and vegetables. He also owns an apartment, from which he earns rental fees. In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses. It’s hard to cover the high cost of living, not to mention educational fees.  

Today, Mahmoud is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas S.A.L to purchase the needed trees, seed, and fertilizers for his lands in order to be able to proceed with his work appropriately. He is very optimistic and hopes to be able to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase the needed trees, seed, and fertilizers for his land.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband owns a costume jewelry shop, which provides the only source of income for the family. 

Her husband wants to purchase jewelry for the shop, including bangles, necklaces, rings and bracelets. Therefore, Samina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the jewelry for her husband's shop. 

She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for the business.

loans.use: To purchase costume jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Al-Amal Group

texts.en:
Al-Amal is a group which consists of 5 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They are hardworking women that make an effort to provide for their families. They applied for a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB.

Saba is 31 years old, married and has 3 children who live in Taiz, Yemen. She is a housewife. She faces a difficult situation where she lives with her family in a poor area. The summer season has begun and she doesn't have money to buy a fridge in order not to spoil food. So she is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB so that she can acquire a fridge to use in the house. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a fridge to use in the house.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Ms Kosar is 38 years old and married. She started a business of cloths trade in her community six months ago. Her husband has a private job and does not earn enough to manage the household expenditures. She has two children; both are school-going. 

She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Kosar is requesting a 25,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Kosar expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Aubrey Marie

texts.en:
Aubrey Marie is a 24-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from San Miguel, Bohol. She earns a living selling various children's toys and other plastic wares for household use. Her husband is also engaged in farming.

Aubrey Marie is asking for a loan to buy more items, such as toys, basins, and kitchen wares, to sell in her store. This will help her augment her store and increase her sales and income. In the future, Aubrey Marie hopes to expand her business in order to generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy items like toys, basins, and kitchen ware to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi, aged 38 years, is a married woman and has three kids all of whom attend school. Her husband is employed as a casual worker and together they live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Mishi has operated a tailoring business for the past seven years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Sanura

texts.en:
Sanura is a single mother; she owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for resale.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 35 years old and is a hard-working and diligent woman. She has four children and her husband is working in a wood shop.

Shazia has done various beautician courses and she is an excellent beautician by profession. She has been running her own beauty salon for five years. She is a very skilled and independent woman and she is helping her husband by running her own business. She spends all of the income generated from the business on the education of children so that they can have a bright future.

Currently she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She would like to expand her business by adding some more space to her salon. Her clients are increasing day-by-day and the current space is too congested so she would build one more room. She would also like to purchase some cosmetic products like lipsticks, facial scrubs etc and also some new hair stylers. This loan could help her to fulfil her dreams.

loans.use: to expand the beauty salon business.

loans.name: Evaliste

texts.en:
Evaliste is a 44-year-old man from Gatsibo District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of 60,000 RWF to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.  

He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife and children.

loans.use: to pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of five children and runs a pub/bar which has been in operation for 13 years. She obtained the business capital from the sale of vegetables.
Maria was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy more crates of liquor for sale.
Despite the inflation which has reduced the public's disposable income, Maria believes she can earn and save extra income for the education of her children, provide income for her employees and also use part of the money to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more crates of liquor for sale.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi, 42, is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en: Sylvester is a 42-year-old married man with six children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a tinsmith business where he makes metallic cookers that are fueled by charcoal. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the KES 40,000 loan  to buy sheets of metal for making the cookers. His business goal is to own a big shop within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal for making cookers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 32-year-old married woman. She has 2 children who are 9 and 14. She operates a beauty salon where she does hair treatment, hair plaiting and braiding. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a business-friendly area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to to buy more hair products for her beauty salon. Her business goal is to be financially stable within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more hair products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en:
Jayson is a resident of Mariakani Kenya. He is a married father of one child and runs a barber shop. He also operates a compact disc sale shop. The businesses have been in operation for the last two years.

Jayson was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy shavers and compact discs to sell.

loans.use: To buy shavers and compact discs to sell.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
This client is 49 years old and lives in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. Nuon began doing farming 32 years ago. He enjoys doing it very much because the experience he has allows him to maintain a fruitful harvest and move his family forward. He is able to generate approximately KHR 10,000 each day.

Nuon is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because this is the second time they've given him their help. This time he'll be able to buy farming inputs which he can apply on his rice, so that he can give good nutrition to his crops and keep improving his farm. His dreams include continuing his life with perseverance, to go far in his business, helping his children become successful in their education, and providing for all of the household needs.

loans.use: to buy farming inputs to apply on his rice.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 56-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a butchery where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to to buy more beef to sell. Her business goal is to own a big butchery within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid back successfully. She will use the profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more beef to sell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 35 years old and is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a broom-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also does farming which provides her with another source of income. Her major challenge in the business is high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting of KES 30,000 she wants to purchase stock of brooms for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of brooms for resale.

loans.name: Catalina Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña catalina vive con su hijo en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura siembra maiz y frijol desde hace 20 años con las ventas que realiza de sus granos basicos logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar, Doña catalina  solicita un credito que le permita comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbisidas y foliares y mejorar la tierra que muestra en la fotografia y seguir con sus cosechas para obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida con su hijo.
texts.en: Catalina lives with her son in a house of her own. She has been a farmer for 20 years and she plants corn and beans. By selling her basic grains she succeeds in paying for her household expenses. Catalina is requesting a loan to buy manure, pesticides, weed-killers and foliage fertilizers: she wants to improve the land you can see at her back in the picture, in order to keep on planting her crops to earn a better income and to reach a better standard of living for herself and her son.

loans.use: To buy manure, pesticides, weed-killers and foliage fertilizers.

loans.name: Saimuhamad

texts.ru:
Саймухамаду 26 лет. Он холостой молодой человек. Саймухамад проживает вместе с родителями и двумя сёстрами в городе Кулябе, в южной части страны. Его отец работает в энергетической компании города Куляб. Мать домохозяйка. 
Саймухамад является мастером по ремонту жилых домов. Сейчас он хотел бы заняться услугой такси в своем городе. У него имеется трехлетний опыт вождения. Саймухамад нуждается в кредите, чтобы приобрести автомобиль и начать свою деятельность. Чтобы реализовать свою цель, он обратился за кредитом.
texts.en: Saimuhamad is 26, and is single. He lives with his parents and two sisters in Kulyab, in southern Tajikistan. His father works for an energy firm in Kulyab. His mother is a homemaker. Saimuhamad is a skilled home repairman, but he would like to start operating a taxi service in his home town. He has three years' driving experience. Saimuhamad needs financial assistance to acquire a car and start his business, and has applied for a loan to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy a car for the purpose of operating a taxi service.

loans.name: Ngock

texts.en:
Ngock is single with five children. They all live in a three bedroom apartment house in Bamenda in the northwest region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, including sickness in her family and the deaths of friends and family members, particularly her father, mother, brothers, sister, and child. The costs of medicine for treating sickness and for funeral preparations have left her with inadequate capital for her business.

With this loan, she will buy flour, yeast, groundnut oil, sugar, a piglet, and feed to enable her to operate her business. She is positive this business will succeed because she has regular customers who often purchase fish from her for ceremonies. She has a good business site, and she has been in this  business for a long time. Her business provides the community with a regular supply of fish, which they often consume for breakfast. In addition, she will provide pig manure, which is used as fertilizer by local farmers.

With the profit from the loan, she will pay her children's school fees and cater to other school needs. She will also educate the children of her late sister and brother. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, groundnut oil, a piglet, and feed.

loans.name: Charellote

texts.en:
Charellote is a 41-year-old woman from Gatsibo District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

She is seeking a loan of RWF 60,000 ( $100 ) to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  

She is also a World Vision volunteer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for grocery-selling business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman aged 24 years, and has been blessed with one child. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. 

For years, she has operated an open air food business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; especially during the rainy season it becomes difficult to operate her business. Grace dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 25-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as determined. He operates a capentry business where he makes sofa sets for sale. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to to buy more materials for making sofa sets like timber, nails and other items. His business goal is to own a big furniture shop within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully. He will use the profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making sofa sets like timber, nails and other items.

loans.name: Fulgence

texts.en:
Fulgence is a 36-year-old man from Gatsibo District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a loan of RWF 60,000 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.

He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife .

loans.use: to pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Trung

texts.en:
Trung was born in 1972. She has three children who are learning at primary school, secondary school and college. Her husband and she sell pork meat in a market to earn a living. Her husband earns about 2,000,000 VND per month. Trung’s income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this job for seven years. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,000,000 VND per month.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to sell more pork meat in the market. She always wants to raise her children well and have more money for her business.

loans.use: to sell more pork meat in the market.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is grateful to Milango and its partners for the previous loan he received. He set up a jewelry business with the extra income. He has seen a potential in this business and is therefore applying for a loan of 21,050 KES to buy bracelets, earrings, chains, etc. for resale. He believes he can increase his income with the jewelry business in addition to the cosmetics business.

loans.use: To buy bracelets, earrings, chains, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Santos Marcos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 50 años de edad, esta acompañado. Es una persona que desde muy pequeño se dedica a la agricultura; oficio que aprendió de sus padres. Él trabaja junto a su esposa, porque sus hijos son mayores de edad y tienen su propia familia. También don Santos trabaja como vigilante en una finca. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, semilla, abono, pesticidas  y pago del alquiler de la tierra para cultivar. Él planea mejorar su vivienda ya que se moja en invierno.
texts.en:
Santos is 50 years old and has a partner.  He is a person who has been working as a farmer since he was very young; he learned this trade from his parents.  He works alongside his wife, since his children are fully grown and have their own family.  Also, Santos works as a security guard on a plantation.

The loan which he is asking for from Fundación Campo, is to buy fertilizer, seeds, soil additives, pesticides, and to pay the rent on his land for cultivation.  He plans to improve his house, since it gets wet during the winter.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, soil additives, pesticides, and to pay the rent on his cultivated lands.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 44 años de edad es una mujer casada y madre de 4 jóvenes hijos, que habita en San Juan Nepomuceno, pueblo reconocido por su tradición artesanal al norte de Colombia.  Ella tenía mucha aptitud por las confecciones y por las artes y por ello decidió hacer un curso para perfeccionar su tradición, y poder generar ingresos que contribuyeran al mejoramiento de su hogar. En un pequeño taller de su casa confecciona y para genera otros ingresos también ofrece servicios de internet y comunicaciones. Su meta es tener un negocio mas amplio y bien dotado donde su clientela se sientan en un ambiente acogedor, bien atendidos y aprovechen la calidad con la cual trabaja Maria, tanto en su confección como en la administración de su pequeña sala de internet. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un computador y aire acondicionado, para dotar su infraestructura de una temperatura agradable y ofrecer la oportunidad a nuevos clientes, que muchas veces necesitan utilizar su servicio de internet y deben marcharse sin recibirlo. Mientras esto ocurre, Maria  maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 33%, que proyecta aumentar gradualmente especialmente con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old, is married and the mother of four young children.  They live in San Juan Nepomuceno, a town known for its artisanal tradition, to the north of Colombia.  She has a great aptitude for tailoring and the arts and because of this she decided to take a class to perfect her tradition and be able to earn more money to contribute to improving her home.

In a small workshop in her home she tailors clothing and to generate income she also offers internet and communications services.  Her goal is to have a larger and well-supplied business where her clients feel like they are in a comfortable environment and well taken care of, where they can appreciate the quality of Maria's work, in her tailoring as well as the administration of her small internet cafe.

This is the reason Maria has turned to a Kiva loan, through which she will buy a computer and air conditioner, to make the building a comfortable temperature and offer services to new clients, that often need to use the internet and will leave if they don't.  While this happens, Maria maintains a profitability over her sales no less than 33%, that is projected to increase gradually, especially with her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy a computer and air conditioner

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Gibrilla, a worker at a sugar company in Magburaka. Through partnering with local companies, SMT is able to provide borrowers like Gibrilla with microloans that are repaid through payroll deduction.

Gibrilla is a 45-year-old man who is married and has four children. All of his children are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. Gibrilla has been working at the sugar company for 10 years. In addition to his work at the company, he is also an agriculturist. He is been doing farming for six years now. Gibrilla has requested a loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to purchase agricultural seeds to plant in his farm and also hire labour to help him till the land.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural seeds to plant in his farm and also to hire labour to help him till the land.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all of them attend school. She is not looking after additional family members.

She has been selling charcoal from home at retail for 10 years, working a full week. She does not have any additional source of income.

She has requested for a loan of Ushs 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more baskets fish for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to expand her business up to wholesale. She joined MCDT in order to get more capital for her business. She rents a house with access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase trousers and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Acner Adrian

texts.es: El señor Acner , habita en el municipio de Veracruz , junto a su esposa la cual labora como comerciante para apoyar con los gastos del hogar, sus planes a futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida, tienen hijos a su cargo y necesitan de su apoyo , el es transportista inpedendiente le brinda su servicio a un colegio privado desde hace 5 años, con este credito que se le ha otorgado comprara Materiales como. Arena, Bloques, Cemento, Perlines, Piedrin, Zinc ya que quiere construir dos cuartos para sus hijos. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de Fondo Kiva.
texts.en: Acner lives in the town of Veracruz with his wife, who works as a retailer to help him paying for their household expenses. He has children who economically depend on him and he wants to improve his standard of living in the future. He is an independent driver and he has been offering his services to a private school for 5 years. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy materials such as sand, blocks, cement, purlins, piedrín (a type of building stone) and zinc that he will use to have a room built for his children. He is grateful to Afodenic for the support they grant him through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy sand, blocks, cement, purlins, piedrín and zinc.

loans.name: Olman Teobaldo

texts.es: Olman es un hombre de 30 años,  casado, que habita en la ciudad de Cartagena: una de las ciudades más lindas de Colombia. Allí se dedica a la venta de frituras y refrescos, como jugos naturales que prepara con las frutas tropicales, propias de cada época y refrescan a sus clientes que disfrutan del calor de su tierra. Desde hace 3 años, Olman aprendió la producción de productos alimenticios fritos, pues su madre también se dedicaba a ello; él   en virtud de generar mayores ventas, se le ocurrió vender los productos que preparaba su madre, de manera ambulante y de allí nació su propio negocio el cual empezó a crecer. Olman poco a poco le invirtió y fue así como compró un triciclo y puso un punto de ventas, en la medida en que fue dando  a conocer su negocio. Sus ventas las realiza de contado, de lunes a sábados desde las 6:30 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche. Sus principales clientes son los transeúntes q del centro de la ciudad pues está ubicado en un lugar eminentemente comercial y esto potencializa su venta. Sus compradores cada vez crecen en número y en pedidos y por eso acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un nuevo triciclo y materias primas e insumos para elaborar frituras y aumentar su producción y su mercado de clientes. Su meta es mas adelante tener mas zonas de acceso y una infraestructura de distribución por todas las calles de la ciudad de Cartagena y especialmente muy cerca a las lindas playas de las que siempre disfruta.
texts.en:
Olman is a 30 year old man. He is married and lives in the city of Cartagena, one of Colombia’s nicest cities. He works there also, selling fried snacks and soft drinks, such as natural fruit juices made from seasonal tropical fruit. His drinks provide welcome refreshment to his customers soaking up the Columbian sun. 

Olman learned to make fried food 3 years ago, as his mother worked in this area also. In order to generate higher sales, he got the idea that he could sell the products his mother was making. He decided to sell these products from a mobile unit. From there he set up his own business, which soon started to grow. 

Olman invested in the business little by little, buying a tricycle and customizing it as a point of sale, and over time people have gotten to know his business. 

His sales are done on a cash basis, from Monday to Saturday from 6:30 in the morning until 11 at night. His main group of customers are the people who frequent the city centre. He locates his tricycle in a business area, which increases his sales capacity. 

The number of customers and the number of orders are constantly increasing. For this reason he has approached Kiva for a loan. This is his first time requesting finance. His request is through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

He will use the money to buy a new tricycle, as well as raw materials and supplies for use in preparing the fried food. In this way he will be able to increase production and increase his market. 

His goal for the future is to operate in more than one area and to have a distribution infrastructure all over Cartagena, in particular close to its lovely beaches, which he himself goes regularly.

loans.use: to buy a new tricycle, as well as raw materials and supplies to make fried food

loans.name: Alberto Hegel L

texts.es: Alberto, de 30 años de edad, trabaja como cajero en un banco, es casado tiene un hijo por quien velar para garantizarle su desarrollo, Alberto está estudiando un postgrado en gerencia financiera está siendo apoyado por sus padres para lograr culminar sus estudios, es por eso que solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación ya que obteniendo dicho título podrá aspirar a un asenso en su centro de trabajo, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus condiciones de vida con su familia.
texts.en: Alberto, who is 30 years old, works as a teller in a bank.  He is married and has one child who he watches to assure his proper development.  Alberto is studying for a postgraduate degree in financial planning, and he is being supported by his parents in order to finish his studies.  It is for this reason that he is asking for a loan to pay for his certification course, since obtaining this title would make him able to get a promotion at his job.  This would allow him to improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for a certification course.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, a married man who describes himself as energetic, operates a retail shop where he sells flour, sugar, salt, bread and other items. His primary customers are locals. A lack of capital is his biggest business challenge.

Stephen will use his first loan with SMEP DTM of Kes 50,000 to buy stocks of flour, sugar, salt and other items to sell in his shop. His business goal is to expand within five years.

loans.use: to buy stocks of flour, sugar, salt and other items to sell in his retail shop.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, a married father of three, describes himself as energetic. He has been operating a tailoring shop where he sews clothes for seven years. His primary customers are locals, and business debts are his biggest challenge. He also farms to supplement his income.

Joseph will use his first loan of Kes 20,000 with SMEP DTM to buy another sewing machine. His business goal is to open a tailoring school within five years.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine.

loans.name: Berta Fatima

texts.es:
La clienta Berta vive en Playas. Tiene aproximadamente 10 años con su pequeña tienda, comenzó trabajando en una empresa de vendedores de confites, hasta que decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta de víveres y abarrotes. 

Se levanta a las 6h00 va a realizar las compras en el mercado, para tener productos frescos a sus clientes, no tiene ninguna dificultad hasta ahora en su negocio.No, es soltera, ni tiene hijos. 

Con el préstamo va a comprar congelador, arroz y productos varios. Su sueño es poder crecer en su negocio, contar con el capital necesario para realizar mejoras en su casa.
texts.en:
Berta lives in Playas.  She's had her small store for about 10 years.  She started out working for a firm selling snacks until she decided to start her own business selling food and groceries.  She rises at six am to go make her purchases in the market in order to have fresh items for her customers.  To date, she's had no difficulty with her business.  She is single and has no children.

She will use the loan to buy a freezer, rice and assorted products.  Her dream is to be able to grown in business and to have the necessary capital to do home improvements.

loans.use: to buy rice,  a freezer and several other things.

loans.name: Juan Francisco
