Warah runs a food stand business. She sells onions, tomato paste, Maggi, and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. Warah says that the main challenge to her business is low purchasing power of customers.

Warah has requested a loan in order to purchase onions, tomato paste, Maggi, and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take good care of her children. In the future, she plans to buy a piece of land. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomato paste, Maggi, and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fruit in Dompoase (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. Esi is married and has seven children.  Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees.

Esi will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of fruit, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, thereby adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fruit, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is a widow and has six children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Adjoa is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells ‘Banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made with fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth, whitish paste) for a living. She normally sells her ‘Banku’ in Dompoase (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 10 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Adjoa uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Adjoa will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, thereby adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling soap in Ensuakyire  (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. Fati is married and has three children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

 Fati  wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of soap. In the long term, Fati plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of soap.

loans.name: Sheedan

texts.en:
Ms Sheedan is 55 years old and the mother of three children.  

Sheedan has been running a business selling milk for about eight years. She started her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family at a point in time when her husband was the only bread earner. With the passage of time, her sales increased, as well as her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She is striving hard to improve her family's standard of living. 

She has some savings, and applied for a loan of Rs. 50,000 to purchase another buffalo. She is in her 6th loan cycle with Kashf Foundation, and is hopeful to increase her sales which ultimately helps generate more cash. 

She dreams of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for milking.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora  Maritza  de 50 años de edad es soltera, vive con su padre no tiene   hijos  que dependen de ella, se dedica desde hace 06 años al negocio de venta abarrotería, golosinas, paletas, tamales, comida y sopas, tiene casa propia y sus clientes le visitan en su casa para comprar sus golosinas.
Doña Martiza desea invertir en su negocio porque por motivos de enfermedad de su padre lo descuido y necesita de capital para volverlo a surtir y poder atender mejor a sus clientes.
Doña Martiza está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos alimenticios como azúcar, frijoles, arroz, café, pan queso, mantequilla, huevos, churros, refrescos etc. para invertirlos en su pulpería y tener ganancias que le permitan mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y el de su familia.
Doña Martiza está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma es su quinto préstamo que solicita.


San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Maritza is 50 years old. She is single and lives with her father. She has no dependent children. For the past 6 years she has run a grocery store business, selling sweets, ice-pops, tamales, food items and soups. She has her own home where customers visit in order to buy their snacks.

Maritza would like to invest in her business as she was not able to look after it for a time because her father was ill, and now she needs capital to restock it and to be able to provide her customers with a better service.

Maritza is requesting this loan to buy food items for her store, such as sugar, beans, rice, coffee, cheese bread, butter, eggs, potato crisps and soft drinks, etc. This will enable her to make a living so that she can imrpove slightly her and her family’s quality of life.

Maritza is very happy to continue working with Prisma. This is her fifth loan request.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, coffee, cheese bread, butter, eggs, potato crisps and soft drinks, etc. for her business

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Ms Shamim is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 25 years. She offers various goods for daily use; Shamim has good communication skills and a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory, and doesn't earn enough income to support his family alone. She is the mother of four children, and is motivated to provide for her family. 

Shamim wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy a stock of rice, grains, and flour from the market at lower rates. This will enable her to consistently meet the increasing demand. She is in her 6th loan cycle, and has shown excellent repayment behavior. 

She wishes to utilize a part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, grains, and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Even though Patience grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. 

Currently, Patience is an entrepreneur. She sells bread in Adentem (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began three years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their one child. 

Patience has identified that there are growing demands among customers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs, due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more bread to sell. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Patience wants to buck the trend by ensuring that her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 42 años de edad, vive a lado de su esposo y su hija en su casa propia.Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulatoria, ya que no cuenta con un local para su negocio y lleva un promedio de 3 años en esta actividad se inició junto a su esposo buscando conseguir ingresos para su hogar, el problema principal es la falta de un puesto o un local para la venta de las ropas, pero aparte de eso también se dedica a la agricultura, desde muy temprano se dirige junto a su esposo a sus chacras que está a 2 horas de su localidad.Rosa está ahorrando, para que más adelante, compre un local ubicado dentro del mercado para que se dedique netamente a la venta de ropas.Este es su primer crédito de kiva, y está muy agradecida por el apoyo y promete puntualidad en sus pagos, para que más adelante pueda solicitar otros préstamos.El dinero solicitado de S/.1500.00 lo invertirá en la compra de ropa al por mayor, para surtir su negocio y dinamizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 42 years old and she lives with her husband and daughter in their own house. She is a street vendor who sells clothing, as she doesn't have a fixed location for her business which she has been doing for about 3 years. She began with her husband looking to obtain income for their family; the main problem is the lack of a stall or premises to sell the clothing. Aside from that she also works in agriculture. From very early she goes with her husband to their small fields, which is 2 hours from their place. 

Rosa is saving, so that in the future, she can buy a place located within the market so that she is dedicated purely to the sale of clothing. This is her first Kiva loan and she is very grateful for the support and she promises to be punctual with her payments, so that in the future she can ask for other loans. 

The money requested, 1500,00 Peruvian soles, she will invest in the purchase of clothing at wholesale and to supply her business and to boost her sales.

loans.use: to purchase clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plaster walls.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana operates a seamstress business in Adentem (near Cape Coast). Christiana is a widow with three children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Christiana uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Christiana will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of sewing supplies, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. As a middle school graduate, Christiana understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of sewing supplies

loans.name: Mpaeki

texts.en:
Mpaeki is 21 years old, married to Sintei, both blessed with two children. Mpaeki has been in this business for the last two years with the monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He is taking out his first loan from KADET LTD of KES 30,000 which he will use to purchase wheat seedlings for planting. The anticipated profit will be used to do large-scale farming. His hopes and dreams are to succeed in farming.

loans.use: to buy wheat  seedlings for planting

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en: Saratu is a 50-year-old female farmer. For most of her life, Saratu’s farm suffered from low yields and reaped only small profits that barely supported her family. Now in her 50s, Saratu is a Babban Gona farmer and for the first time will receive access to substantial credit in the form of  high quality inputs such as improved seeds and high quality fertilizers. As a Babban Gona member, she now has the opportunity to triple her yields and her income, and she is excited by this opportunity; her exact words were “Babban Gona must be sent from God, I thank God for it.” Now, Saratu can actually dream about having a better life and giving her children a better future. She hopes that year after year she will grow the size of land she has under Babban Gona in order to earn more money. She has never owned a car in her life, and she hopes that the profits she earns through Babban Gona will finally give her the means to be able to do so. Her biggest dream is for her five children -- Hajara, Mikia, Zachariah, Isau and Dinatu -- to learn English and get a world-class education.

loans.use: To access agricultural inputs and technologies to increase maize yields and ultimately profitability

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en: Katrina is a female Babban Gona farmer residing in the village of Nakala. Like all Babban Gona farmers, Katrina stands the chance to triple her yield and income this upcoming planting season by accessing a Babban Gona loan. A Babban Gona loan will ensure that Katrina has access to high quality inputs and services such as improved seeds, fertilizers, and extension services that she needs to cultivate high yields and high quality maize.  Katrina has expressed her desire to be among the most successful Babban Gona farmers this year. She is focused on working hard to ensure that she earns as much profit as possible from her 0.6 hectares in order to send her children to school.

loans.use: To access agricultural inputs and technologies to increase maize yields and ultimately profitability

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is one of the youngest Babban Gona members. At the age of 22, this young woman is determined to make a better life for herself than what her parents had. Jamila is excited about the potential of tripling her yields and profits through Babban Gona. On her 1.6 hectare farm in the village of Nakara, Jamila is targeting yields of 50 bags/hectare, or three times the national average. A Babban Gona loan will give Jamila access to high quality seeds, improved fertilizer, and other criticial inputs and services that will make her goal achievable.

loans.use: To access agricultural technologies and inputs that will increase maize yields and ultimately farmer profitability

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is one of the newest members of Babban Gona. Naomi saw fellow women do well in Babban Gona last year and so she joined this year. She is particularly excited about the opportunity to triple her yields and income this season. Through a Babban Gona loan, Naomi will receive improved seeds, high quality unadulterated fertilizer, and other inputs. With seven children to look after, Naomi is excited to earn substantial profits from her plot. In the upcoming years she hopes to scale and earn enough to give all of her children a tertiary education such that they can grow up to impact the lives of others.

loans.use: To access agricultural inputs and technologies that increase maize yields and ultimately farmer profitability

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1982 à Bamako, RAMATA vit avec ses 4enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire dans la commune rurale de Ouelessebougou. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  très vite RAMATA s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus et opta pour l’achat vente de produits alimentaires.
Après avoir correctement remboursé  ses trois prêts précédents elle est à son quatrième prêt individuel qui sera destiné à la constitution de stocks de condiments et denrées alimentaires. 
Elle s’approvisionne une fois par semaine à Bamako et compte avoir avec ce prêt 60  kilogrammes de condiments, 2 tonnes de céréales diverses  et des sacs  tubercules.
Elle effectue ses ventes en détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100.000 FCFA qui servira à rembourser les échéances du prêt, aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir dans ses affaires.
texts.en:
Born around 1982 in Bamako, Ramata lives with her four children and her husband in a nuclear family, in the rural commune of Ouelessebougou.  Since she did not have the opportunity to go far in her studies, she quickly got involved in income-generating activities and decided to start buying and selling food products.

Having duly repaid three previous loans, Ramata is taking her fourth individual loan, which will be used to build up stocks of condiments and food products.

Ramata buys her supplies from Bamako once a week.  With this loan, she is planning to buy 60 kilograms of condiments, two tonnes of various grains and some bags of tubers.

She sells for cash and sometimes on credit to a diverse and mixed retail customer base.

She is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 100,000 CFA francs, which will be used to repay her loan according to her repayment schedule, to help her husband provide for the family, and to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy food products (condiments, grains and tubers).

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, who lives in Kampala, Uganda, is a single mother of seven children, six of whom attend school. She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Working seven days a week, Margaret has been selling green bananas, her sole source of income, from home for 20 years. Her challenges include seasonality.

Margaret has requested a loan of UShs 100,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more green bananas to sell. Her dream is to accumulate profits that will help her educate her children up to university. She joined MCDT because of their interest in the poor people in the community.

loans.use: To buy more green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association SIGUIKAFO de TIELE. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans sont mariées et mères de trois enfants.  Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments et la restauration  à l’image de MASSIRE qui est la première personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
MASSIRE, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, ½  sac de sel, 2 sacs de riz  et 2 paniers de choux, tomate fraîche, oignons, aubergines à des fins de restauration.  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et TIELE et vend ses aliments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA  qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
The BENKADI group is part of the SIGUIKAFO association of Tiélé.  It comprises four women who know one another through family and neighborhood ties and whose average age is 25.  These women are married and have an average of three children each.  They conduct various activities such as buying and selling condiments or preparing meals.  Massire, standing, first from the right in the photo, is involved in the preparation of meals.  These women live in large extended families in Tiélé, Cercle of Kati (Koulikoro region, republic of Mali).

The members of the group have been involved in small retail business for several years and their products and services are in high demand.

Eager to meet their customers' increasing needs, they decided to join the loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso.  This is their sixth solidarity loan.

Massire is planning to use her loan to buy half a bag of salt, two bags of rice and two baskets of cabbage, fresh tomatoes, onions and eggplants, for the preparation of meals.  She buys her supplies in Bamako and Tiélé and  sells her food products in Tiélé, for cash and on credit, to a retail customer base consisting of men and women.

She is hoping to make a monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs, which will allow her to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy food supplies for the preparation of meals.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, aged 33 years, is a married woman with four kids, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma operates a grocery business, a vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of market competition from grocery operators. 

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia sells plastic bowls in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been educated until the end of Junior High School.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. 

Olivia has been working in this enterprise for three years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her plastic bowl enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Monica is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling groceries in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for one year. 

Monica is married and has three children. Her husband works as a trader. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Monica wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries. 

In the long term, Monica plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries.

loans.name: Twizerimana Group

texts.fr:
Alice fait partie du groupe  Twizerimana et  habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve de  39 ans . Elle a 3 enfants âgés de 12 à 22 ans,  tous   étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de farine  de maïs et de manioc depuis  5 ans. 

Elle est à son quatorzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de farine  de maïs et de manioc à revendre pour  gagner plus.

Le gain de son commerce, lui permet de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille : se nourrir, se vêtir, payer les frais  scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Alice is a member of the Twizerimana group and she lives in Gitega.  She is a 39-year-old widow and the mother of three children, aged 12 to 22, who all go to school.

Alice has been selling maize and cassava flour for five years.

This is her fourteenth loan with Turame.  With this loan, financed by KIVA, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of maize and cassava flour for resale, in order to make more money.

With the earnings from her business, Alice is able to meet her family's needs: she manages to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of maize and cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Hananah

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Hananah did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Hananah sells vegetables in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about five years. As a widow with six children, Hananah uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Hananah will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of vegetables, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Hananah wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of vegetables.

loans.name: Pajomel Ajtikonel, Tzununá Group

texts.es:
Esquipulas es el líder del Grupo Pajomel Ajtikonel Tzununá (de  playera  azul en la fotografía) es un señor  de 35 años de edad quien  tiene 3 hijos quienes son hombres.
El es caficultor, la siembra, mantenimiento y producción de café  lo realiza en su parcela, eligió esta actividad por su rentabilidad y lleva  15 años dedicándose a esta labor, de esta manera obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos para el sostenimiento familiar.
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de fertilizante para el mantenimiento de su café.
Sueña con tener un vivero para diversificar  e incrementar sus ingresos, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Esquipulas is the leader of the communal bank "Grupo Pajomel Ajtikonel Tzununá" (he is wearing a blue t-shirt in the photograph).  He is a 35-year old man who has three sons.  
Esquipulas is a coffee grower who plants, maintains and produces coffee.  He does so on his plot of land.  He decided on this line of works because of its profitability and has been making his living with this work for fifteen years.  He earns the majority of his income for supporting his family through this work. 
He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop. 
Esquipulas dreams of having a nursery to diversify and thereby increase his income in order to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.ru: Мукаррам кредитуется второй раз. Она добросовестная, честная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в сельской местности и с детства занималась выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Мукаррам более 10 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры как ячмень и другие зерновые культуры. Ее муж является разнорабочим и имеет маленький доход. Они живут очень бедно. Мукаррам имеет сестру, которая является самым близким человеком для нее. Она планирует выйти замуж, но ее родители не имеют денег для проведения свадебного мероприятия. Мукаррам хочет помочь сестре и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для проведения свадебного мероприятия сестры. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mukarram is a conscientious, honest and hardworking woman who is taking a loan for the second time.  

She was born in the countryside and has been involved in agriculture ever since she was a child.  She is married and raising four children.  She has been a farmer for more than 10 years, growing barley and other grains.  Her husband, an unskilled laborer, makes a small income.  Mukarram and her husband are very poor.

Mukarram has a sister with whom she is extremely close.  Her sister is planning to get married but their parents do not have enough money to pay for the wedding celebration.  Mukarram wants to help her sister, and this is why she is requesting a loan of $3,000 to pay for her sister's wedding celebration.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her sister's wedding celebration.

loans.name: Umida

texts.ru: Дом, где живет Умида и ее семья очень старый и не отвечает стандартам жилья. Так как она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры и получает маленький доход, она не может построить новый дом в течение многих лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 5  детей. Ее муж занимается услугой мастера по ремонту дома. Ее дети еще не имеют источник большого дохода. Она хочет построить новый дом по новой планировке со всеми условиями. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 700 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов для постройки нового дома.  Она ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en:
The house in which Umida and her family live is very old and does not meet housing standards.  However, since Umida is involved in farming and makes a small income, she has not been able to build a new house for many years.  

Umida is married and raising five children.  Her husband works as a handyman.  Her children do not provide an important source of income yet.  

Umida wants to build a new house with a new layout and all the amenities.  She is requesting a loan of $700 to buy some building materials for the construction of her new house.  She is awaiting your kindness and promises to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy building materials to build a new house.

loans.name: Nafaa

texts.en:
Nafaa, aged 36 years, is a widow and a mother of three children; all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nafaa operates a kerosene-selling business, selling from home to her village. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase on credit. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop to increase her monthly income.

With the loan of Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase 120 litres of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase 120 litres of kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 43 años de edad, esta casada y vive en una casa propia, acompañada de su esposo y su hija .Delia tiene una radio el cual lo administra junto a su esposo, lleva en este negocio más de 8 años, fue su cuñado quien la inicio en esta actividad ya que en un principio ella solo era una trabajadora, pero con el pasar de los años se quedo como dueña de dicha emisora. Antes de tener la actividad que tiene ahora, Delia tenía problemas económicos, porque no tenía trabajo y le era muy difícil encontrar uno, pero con perseverancia y esmero salió adelante, y ahora aparte de administrar su radio, también administra una funeraria obteniendo un ingreso extra para su hogar y la de su familia. Espera seguir creciendo como trabajadora y hacer crecer a su pequeña empresa para brindar un mejor calidad a sus oyentes.Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que está muy emocionada y agradece el apoyo económico recibido.Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000.00 pagara los estudios superiores de su hija .
texts.en:
Delia is 43 years old. She is married, and she lives in her own home with her husband and daughter. Delia has a radio broadcast that she runs with her husband. She has eight years experience with this work after her brother-in-law introduced her to it.

At first, she was only a worker, but as the years went by, she became the owner of the transmitter. Before she began the work she does now, Delia had economic difficulties, because she did not have work and it was very hard to find some.  But with perseverance and care, she came out on top. Now, apart from running her radio station, she also runs a funeral home, which brings in extra income for her home and family. 

She hopes to continue to grow as a worker and to make her small businesses grow so that she can bring better quality to her listeners. This is her first Kiva loan, and she is very excited and grateful for the economic support that it brings. With the S/.1000.00 loan, she will pay the higher education costs for her daughter.

loans.use: pay her daughter's higher education expenses.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Even though Diana grew up in poverty and without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. 

Currently, Diana is an entrepreneur. She sells groceries in Adentem (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began one year ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. 

Diana has identified that there are growing demands among customers for her products. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more groceries to sell. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Diana wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Renan

texts.es:
El señor José es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio, el cual es la venta de ropa de varón y de mujer, desde hace 4 años.
Don José realiza las ventas de manera ambulante en su motocicleta, contando con los clientes de diversas comunidades, también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa en la administración del negocio, José también se dedica a la siembra de yuca y de granos básicos generándole un ingreso extra en su patrimonio familiar.
Don José con el apoyo obtenido en los prestamos anteriores pudo construir su vivienda comprar mas producto y ha salido adelante grandemente, siendo una persona emprendedora en su comunidad, está el préstamo para la compra de blusas, camisas, calzonetas, blúmeres, braseares e insumos agrícolas para la preparación de tierras para la siembra de maíz, yuca y frijol que son su otro actividad.
Don José sueña con tener una caseta y poder comprar abarrotería para expandir su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.       


Danlí, Honduras - Abril 2013
texts.en:
José is a very hard-working person, and he devotes himself to his business selling men's and women's clothing, which he has had for four years. He carries out his business by motorcycle, relying on customers from various communities. He also relies on the support of his wife in running the business. 

José also plants yucca and some simple grains, generating extra income toward his family's assets. With the support from his previous loans, he was able to build his home and purchase additional products, and he has come out on top. He is an entrepreneur in the community. 

With this loan, he will purchase blouses, shirts, swimming trunks, undergarments, as well as farming supplies for preparing the ground for planting corn, yucca, and beans for his other business.

José dreams of having a stall for his shop and of being able to buy a grocery to expand his business and improve his income.

Danlí, Honduras - April 2013

loans.use: purchase shirts, blouses and other clothing for his clothing retail, as well as farming supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es: Mónica de 39 años de edad habita al suroccidente de la ciudad con su esposo y su pequeña hija de 11 años, con quien sueña ver convertida en una persona exitosa y bien educada, porque ella es justamente quien motiva sus tareas diarias. Monica tiene desde hace 11 años experiencia en imagen y belleza, la cual convirtió en un negocio generador de ingresos, a través del cual ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal, como tinturas, cortes de cabellos, masajes capilares, tinturados etc. Su idea de negocio nació después de haber estudiado en una academia donde impulsaron su aptitud por este arte. Sus principales clientes son mujeres, hombres y niños, a quienes está dispuesta a atender diariamente, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos, como cremas, tinturas, esmaltes en mayor volumen, para obtener mejores descuentos y aumentar sus utilidades. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propio local y este también, es el gran desafío de Mónica, por el cual trabaja con mucho esmero.
texts.en: Mónica, who is 39-years old, lives in the southwest of the city with her husband and young, 11-year old daughter.   Mónica dreams of seeing her daughter become a successful and well-educated person.  She is Mónica's motivation for tending to her daily tasks.  Monica has eleven years experience in appearance and beauty, which she turned into a income-generating business.  She offers services in improving one's personal appearance, like dyes, haircuts, scalp massage, hair coloring etc.  Her idea for the business was born after having studied at an academy where they propelled her aptitude for this art.  Mónica's main customers are women, men and children.  She is open for her customers from 8:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it she will purchase supplies like lotions, dyes and nail polish in larger volume so she can get better discounts on her purchases and increase her profits.  Her goal in the future is to have her own store front.  This is also her greatest challenge, which is why she works with so much care.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like lotions, dyes and nail polish, in larger volume.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz Marina de cincuenta y tres años vive en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, es madre soltera que ha sacado adelante su familia solamente con el esfuerzo de ella, es una persona de buenas costumbres  y labora en una universidad del estado desde hace diecinueve años desempeñándose como conserje.
  
Doña Luz marina se presento a CEPRODEL para  solicitar  un financiamiento para gastos de materiales de construcción como es láminas de cinz, perlin y soldadura para la reparación del techo que esta en mal estado.

Con este  financiamiento que Kiva-Ceprodel le brindara lo invertirán en el mantenimiento y le dará seguridad a su vivienda para un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Señora Luz Marina, who is fifty-three years old, lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua.  She is a single mother who has gotten her family ahead by herself, through her own hard work.  She is a person with good habits and has worked as a custodian in a state university for nineteen years. 
  
Doña Luz Marina came to CEPRODEL to request a loan for construction materials, like sheet metal, beams and fasteners.  She wants to repair her roof, which is in bad condition. 

With this loan from Kiva-Ceprodel, Doña Luz Marina will invest in maintenance, which will provide security to her home for a better quality of life.

loans.use: with construction costs.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Ms Samina is a 38-year-old married woman. For the past 11 years, Samina has been running a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only breadwinner at that point in time. Now, she has one buffalo, two goats and one donkey. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She is in her fourth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She is requesting a loan of Rs 18,000/- to purchase a donkey cart and food for her cattle. It will help her to reach more people in her community. She expects a boost in her business income through her larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase a donkey cart and food for her cattle.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is involved in selling vegetables and fish in Adentem (near Cape Coast). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is in construction) support their three children. She has been involved in selling vegetables and fish for three years now. She plans to use her loan to purchase additional amounts of vegetables and fish, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity. She aspires to use her profits, to both better market her vegetables and fish enterprise and to increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of vegetables and fish to sell

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is a 25-year-old man who has a motorcycle business. He is applying for a loan of KES 15,000, which will be used to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle business. He has been in the motorcycle business for the past four years and is also running a farming business. This is his first application for a loan through SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motorcycle business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has a retail shop in Nakuru town. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more stock of tea leaves, coffee sachets, maize flour, and rice for resale. She paid her previous loan on time.

In the future, Margaret hopes to grow her retail shop and buy a plot.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tea leaves, coffee sachets, maize flour, and rice to sell

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, four of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other family members. She has been selling body oils in a shop at retail for one year, working four days a week. She does not have an additional source of income. She has requested a loan of UGX 100,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more boxes of cosmetics and hair and body oils for sale. Her challenge includes thieves. Her dream is to own a big fully stocked cosmetics shop in her own premises. She joined MCDT because she wanted to uplift her standard of living. She stays with her husband in a rented house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Kweku

texts.en: Although he has received no prior formal education, Kweku is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling charcoal in Domenase (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for seven years. Kweku is married and four children. His wife works as a farmer. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Kweku wants to use his loan to increase his current inventory levels, allowing him to sell greater quantities of charcoal. In the long term, Kweku plans to reinvest future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a small-scale footwear saleswoman in Domenase (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education since she is senior high school graduate. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader. Nana has been working as a footwear saleswoman for close to six years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans to use her loan to purchase an increased quantity of shoes, thus allowing her to meet the rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.a

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of shoes to sell

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with two children under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits. For that reason, with the KSHS 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, and watermelons. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, and watermelons,

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
This is Mwanasha. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy products such as beans, rice, sugar, and meat. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for KSHS 20,000 to pay school fees for her children and add stock to her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children and buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Hannah is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling water in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. Hannah is married and has five children. Her husband works in construction. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Hannah will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of water, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of water to sell

loans.name: Marie Madellene

texts.fr:
Madame  Marie Madellene  est âgée de 62 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit chez son mari  avec ses enfants au quartier Sébougou extension  de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté  l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt à faire les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à son coté, elle finit seule à  mener plusieurs activités (vente d’habits et chaussures etc.) bien avant d’embrasser le commerce d’arachide. Elle fait cette activité depuis 18 ans et bénéficie d’un bon réseau de clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à sa technique de fidéliser de  sa clientèle mais également à son prix abordable  ainsi qu’à la qualité de sa marchandise.   
 Dans le but  d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 72 mois, après 10 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt  individuel bien  remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser  pour acheter, 15 sacs d’arachide,  elle s’approvisionne à San auprès des producteurs.  
Madame  Marie Madellene  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes et avec ce prêt  elle envisage   réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 60.000 FCFA. Ce dernier lui permettra  de prendre en charge les dépenses familiales et d’augmenter son fonds de  commerce.  Son ambition est de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Marie Madellene is 62 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She lives with her husband and children in the Sébougou neighborhood, Cercle of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).

Since she did not attend school, due to social circumstances, Marie Madellene got involved in income-generating activities at a very young age, following her mother who was selling condiments.  After several years of apprenticeship alongside her mother, she ended up conducting several activities by herself (selling clothes and shoes etc.) long before she started selling groundnuts.  Marie Madellene has now been involved in this activity for 18 years and she enjoys a good network of customers.  She owes her strength as a seller to her ability to build customer loyalty, to her reasonable prices and to the good quality of her merchandise.

She turned to Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase her business and to meet customer demand.  She has been a client of Soro Yiriwaso for the past six years and has already taken one solidarity loan and one individual loan, which have all been duly repaid.  This loan, her second individual loan, will be used to buy 15 bags of groundnuts.  She buys her merchandise from producers, in the town of San.

Marie Madellene sells for cash and on credit to a customer base which mostly consists of women.  Thanks to this loan, she is expecting to make a monthly profit of 60,000 CFA francs, which will help her to take care of the family's expenses and to increase her business.

Her ambition is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy some bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Buzigire Group

texts.fr: La cliente TORWA est secrétaire  du  groupement d’affaire Buzigire, jeune entrepreneur,  âgée de 28 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants, qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un scieur de bois.  La cliente est vendeuse des poissons. Elle étale ses marchandises au long de la rue.  Elle commença cette affaire avec son fonds reçu de son oncle. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le crédit de l’IMF Hekima.  Il y a environs 6 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  150 poissons à marchander. L’insécurité, la crise financière  sont de défis majeurs pour son activité. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants. In fine, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.
texts.en:
Torwa is the vice-secretary of the business group Buzigire. A young entrepreneur, Torwa is 28 years old, married, and a mother of six children, who all go to school. Her husband is a sawyer. 

Torwa has been selling fish for a living for about six years. She lays out her goods along the road. She started this business with funds from her uncle. Later, she benefited from a loan with the MFI Hekima. This new loan will allow her to buy 150 fish to sell. Insecurity and the financial crisis are major challenges to her business. She hopes to increase her capital and educate her children. 

Finally, she wants to strongly thank Hekima for their support in micro-lending.

loans.use: to buy 150 fish

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Godelive

texts.en:
Godelive is 46 years old. She is married to a house builder. The husband builds houses for other people.

With the loan, she would like to buy more glasses for sale in construction. This loan will be used for buying more glasses to increase her inventory. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more glasses for sale.

loans.name: Rokhaya's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 6 femmes qui habitent le même village, leur activité principal est le commerce ,il est a son 12éme prêt.
Rokhaya est la représentante du groupe,elle a levé sa main sur la photo. Elle a 54 ans ,mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 3 garçons et 4 filles. Son ainé a 30 ans et son cadet 12 ans.
Elle fait du commerce de légume dans le marché de la ville la plus proche de son village. Elle fait cet activité depuis 5 ans et ne se plein pas car malgré la concurrence elle arrive toujours a écouler sa marchandise. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter des légumes à 30000f et des poissons fumés à 100000f.
Avec ses bénéfices elle aide son marie dans les dépenses de la maison a savoir nourriture, scolarisation et santé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of six women who live in the same village. Their primary activity is commerce and they are on their 12th loan. 

Rokhaya is the representative of the group and has her hand raised in the photo. She is 54 year old, married, and a mother of seven children, of whom 3 are boys and 4 are girls. Her eldest child is 30 years old and her youngest is 12 years old. 

Rokhaya sells vegetables in the town market that is closest to her village. She has been doing this for five years, and she doesn't complain because despite competition she always manages to sell her goods. 

With this loan she hopes to buy vegetables at 30,000 francs and smoked fish at 100,000 francs. With her earnings, she [will] help her husband with the household expenses including food, schooling, and health needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at 30,000 francs and smoked fish at 100,000 francs

loans.name: Nianankoro

texts.fr:
NIANANCORO  est âgé de 59 ans et vit avec ses sept enfants et son épouse dans la sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Région de KOULIKORO.
NIANANCORO  n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son ami d’enfance. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursés les trois prêts précédents il est à son quatrième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 2,5 tonnes de céréales auprès des paysans producteurs de DONGORONA et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.
NIANANCORO espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 80.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
NIANANKORO, age 59, lives with his wife and their seven children in the sub-prefecture of OUELESSEBOUGOU, region of KOULIKORO.

NIANANKORO did not have the opportunity to go to school. He became involved in income-generating activities at a young age, namely the purchase, storage and sale of cereals. He learned this activity alongside a childhood friend. 

To satisfy a growing customer base, he turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and having correctly repaid three loans, he is now seeking a fourth individual loan to buy 2,5 tonnes of cereals (maize, millet, fonio) from local farmers  in DONGORONA and the neighboring areas. He will store the grain for at least three months. He sells mainly wholesale to a clientele consisting of resellers from large cities such as Bamako and OUELESSEBOUGOU.

NIANANKORO hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA, which he will use to repay the loan. Any remainder will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plantains, oil, yuca, etc.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is a widowed mother who lives in Msambweni. She sells bread with the help of her family. Her first loan was very beneficial for her, since she was able to buy wheat flour, beans, cooking oil, and sugar. Before that, she did not have enough capital to work with, and the loan came when she needed it the most. She has paid the installments in time.
She always struggles to improve her food stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Sharifa is requesting a loan to buy beans, sugar, oil, rice, and wheat flour.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, rice, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a vegetable-selling stall, and she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en: Suleiman is a married man. He has three children. He operates a tailoring business where he sews clothes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a new sewing machine. His business goal is to own a big tailoring shop within five years. He will use the profits to open a new shop.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a  Kiva borrower. He has three children with ages ranging from one to two years old. He operates a tailoring business where he sews clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to to open a new tailoring shop. His business goal is to expand within five years. He will use the profits to buy a bigger sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a bigger sewing machine

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana está muy feliz con su credikiva, por eso envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva : “ Su apoya ha sido fundamental para el logro de mis objetivos. “ Ella con su anterior credikiva logró  comprar mucho maíz para la preparación de sus pasabocas que organizó en bandejas y tuvieron mucho impacto comercial; también invirtió en mercancías variadas como colonias, perfumes, artículos de aseo, que vendió a un buen precio y hasta le alcanzó para hacer adecuaciones locativas a su vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará cárnicos, harinas, azúcar, bandejas, y mercancías como perfumes y ladrillos y eternit, para concluir el mejoramiento de su vivienda, con lo que beneficiará el modo de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Viviana is very happy with her Kivaloan, which is why she is sending the following message to Kiva lenders: "Your support has been fundamental for the achievement of my objectives." With her previous Kivaloan she was able to buy a lot of corn for the preparation of her tasty snacks that she organized on trays and which had good commercial success. She also invested in the purchase of a variety of merchandise such as colognes, perfumes and toiletries, which she sold at a good price and even allowed her to make improvements to her home. Currently, she is requesting a new loan with which to buy meat, flours, sugar, trays and merchandise such as perfumes, as well as bricks and fibre cement to finish improving her home, which will improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to invest in a variety of merchandise such as colognes, perfumes and toiletries.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Gifty did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Gifty sells foodstuff in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about four years. She is married to a driver, and together they have three children. Gifty uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Gifty will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of foodstuff, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Gifty wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of foodstuff, which will aid her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en:
Even though Sabrina grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Sabrina is an entrepreneur. She sells groceries in Adentem (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began three years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. 

Sabrina has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more groceries to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sabrina wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, aged 38 years, is married and has four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a coconut selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other coconut sellers.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: After graduating junior high school, Gladys decided to set up her own seamstress business in Adentem (near Cape Coast). With over four years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more sewing materials. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is in construction) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their one child is able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Comfort is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling gari (a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched, powdered cassava). She usually sells her gari in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling gari for two years. Comfort is married and has two children. Her husband works in construction. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Comfort wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty gari. In the long term, Comfort plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, thus increasing her current inventory levels

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela would like to apply for another loan. This time she has requested KES 35,000 to buy more clothes for children, men and women. She started to sell clothes at the market thanks to her mother, who has had a stand for several years. 

She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her business and renew the stock for her clothes selling business. She is grateful for this opportunity as it will allow her to continue growing and improving the lifestyle of her and her family.

loans.use: to restock her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Omoiti Samson

texts.en:
Omoiti Samson is a 25-year-old businessman who lives in Nimule. He is married with one child, age 3, who goes to school. Omoiti Samson runs a general store, and has been in business for five years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 3,000 SSP (South Sudan pounds) to purchase more mirrors, pans and many other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In five years, Omoiti Samson would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs.

Omoiti Samson says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like pans and mirrors.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 2 children that are 3 and 9 years old. She operates a retail store where she sells sugar, drinks, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a commercial area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of sugar, flour, drinks and other items. Her business goal is to open a wholesale outlet within 5 years. She will use the profits to educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, flour, drinks and other items to her store.

loans.name: Zamzam

texts.en:
Zamzam is 34 years old, and married with one child under her care. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
Zamzam wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vendor in the area to be able to raise her profits.
For that reason with the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw.

loans.name: Helina

texts.en: Helina is divorced and has 3 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Helina is a successful businesswoman. She sells fried and fresh fish in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 2 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Helina uses her income to provide for the entire family. Helina will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Helina plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Gloria is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling groceries in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for a number of years. Gloria is married and has 2 children. Her husband works in construction. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Gloria wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries. In the long term, Gloria plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries.

loans.name: Chakure

texts.en:
Chakure is a 29-year-old married woman who has three children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past ten years, she has operated an open air food stall business. Her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality of products in the market.
With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour, rice and furniture for the food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour, rice and furniture for the food stall.

loans.name: La Gloire De Dieu 3 Group

texts.en:
Elvis is 23 years old and single with no children yet. He is representing the La Gloire de Dieu 3 group. Elvis has a grocery stand where he sells a variety of food and home products. He has had this business for 1 year. He will use the loan to buy cookies, juice, and matches to stock his store. His business strategy is to give a small gift to his returning customers. He gives them a little extra of something that he knows they like.
Elvis has received 2 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. In the future, Elvis would like to have a hardware store.

loans.use: to pay for cookies, juice, and matches.

loans.name: Jamson

texts.en: Jamson who is in his mid-30’s is married with 7 school-aged children, some of whom he adopted from his relatives who have passed away. He started a cycle transport business after he had to drop out of school for lack of school fees. He realized that a cycle transport business alone could not sustain him and his family so he decided to invest in coffee production. He has now started reaping big from his coffee farm and now wishes to invest more in his farm. Jamson is proud of educating his children and taking care of the entire family as he compares himself to his friends who finished their studies. His main challenge now is inadequate capital to buy organic manure to put in his newly planted coffee. He therefore wants to take this loan to buy manure for the coffee gardens.

loans.use: to buy manure for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is 26 years old and married with three children, all of whom are under her care. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
Tima wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to have a leading fruit vending business in the area which will help to raise her profits.
For that reason with the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw.

loans.name: Williams Moi

texts.en:
Williams Moi is a 28-year-old business man who lives in Nimule. He is married with 2 children who are 3 and 6 years old, and the 6-year-old attends school. Williams Moi runs a general store, and has been in this business for 7 years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 3000 SSP to purchase more soda, water, soap, and many other items for his store. The store is his only source of income. In 5 years William Moi would like to expand his business.
His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs.
Williams Moi says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: for buying items like soda, water, milk, soap, etc. for his store.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is 42 years old, is married, and has six kids, four boys and two girls who all attend school. She has owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past eight years, she has operated a door-to-door motorcycle transport business. Her potential customers are her neighbors. Her major challenge is seasonality, especially during the rainy season, because it becomes difficult to operate her business.
With the KES 25,000 she wants buy an inventory of coconuts. This will allow her to start another business of selling coconuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of coconuts.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
La señora Deysi es una persona muy  emprendedora, responsable, honesta y trabajadora,  madre soltera vive  con  sus  2 hijas en un barrio de Choluteca al sur de Honduras.
Doña Deysi su negocio es el alquiler de un apartamento y también tiene un taxi en el cual ofrece el servicio de transporte. El préstamo lo necesita para la  reparación de su taxi que es una de sus fuentes de ingreso.  
Doña Deysi en el futuro  espera que  su servicio de taxi sea el más  eficiente y el mejor  de  esa  zona. Gracias a la inversión hecha en el mismo y sueña con ver a sus hijos y nietos convertirlos en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades  para la  sociedad



Choluteca, Honduras –  Abril  del  2013
texts.en:
Deysi is very enterprising, responsible, honest and hard-working.  She is a single mother and lives with her two daughters in the Choluteca barrio, in the south of Honduras.

Deysi makes a living renting out an apartment and driving a taxi.  She needs a loan to repair her vehicle, as it is a source of income for her.

In the future Deysi hopes to have the best and most efficient taxi service in town thanks to this investment in her service.  Deysi dreams of seeing her children and grandchildren become good people in society, and with better opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras, April 2013

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a business.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 34 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica al cuido de unos sobrinos y a los quehaceres del hogar; su compañero de vida es motorista de transporte colectivo de pasajeros. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para realizar tramites de permiso, tarjeta, etc. para que su compañero de vida pueda continuar trabajando como motorista sin ningún inconveniente; ya que sino porta toda la documentación no puede trabajar y su familia no tendrá ingresos para los gastos del hogar. Además, que trabajara sin temor a que la policía lo multe por no cargar sus documentos en regla. Su propósito, es instalar su propio negocio y que su compañero de vida posea su propia unidad de transporte y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Antonia is 34 years old.  She has a partner and two children.  She looks after some of her nephews and takes care of the household chores while her partner makes a living as a driver.

Antonia is applying for a loan from "Fundación Campo" in order to apply for a new driving licence and medallion so that her partner can continue his work as a driver without any hassles.  Without the necessary paperwork, he cannot work and the family will not have an income to cover household costs.  Having the documents will also allow him to work without fear that he will be stopped and fined by the police for not having his paperwork in order.  Antonia's plans for the future include starting up her own business, for her husband to have his own vehicle and to buy a house.

loans.use: to apply for a a driving licence and taxi medallion so that her life life partner can continue to work as a driver without any hassles.

loans.name: Daba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 8 femmes fait partie du Banc Villageois crée le 13 décembre 2008. Il regroupe des femmes qui habitent le même village et des alentours. Elles font comme activité principale le commerce. Elles vivent une parfaite solidarité dans le Banc Villageois
Daba debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 33 ans.Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont un garçon. Elle fais de l'embouche ovine comme activité, elle achète des moutons que qu'elle engraisse pour les revendre au bout de 5 mois. Avec le prêt reçu elle compte acheter 14 moutons à raison de 25000f l'unité. Elle va aussi acheter de l'aliment de bétail pour leur nourriture.
Les bénéfices générés lui serviront à épargner et à aider son mari à prendre en charge la famille.
texts.en:
This groups is made up of eight women and is part of the Banc Villageois that was established on December 13, 2008. It comprises women from one single village and its surroundings. Their main business is retail. They exhibit strong solidarity with the Banc Villageois. 

Daba, age 33, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's married and the mother of five children, including one boy. Her business consists in raising sheep. She buys sheep that she fattens in order to resell them after five months.

With her loan, she intends to buy 14 sheep for XOF 25'000 (ca US$ 50) a piece. She will also buy food to feed them. She will use her profits to put money away and help her husband take care of the family.

loans.use: to buy 14 sheep and food to feed them

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de 5 femmes ont une bonne cohésion sociale. Elles habitent la même localité 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la représentante Awa est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'une fille vivant avec elle. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter du riz, de l'huile, des légumes, de la viande, du poisson et du café pour une valeur de 500 000 frs. 

Les bénéfices générés lui permettent de renforcer ses épargnes et d'appuyer son mari dans les charges familiales comme le ravitaillement et les fournitures scolaires de sa fille qui en formation.
texts.en:
This group is composed of five women who are all friends and live in the same area. Standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised is Awa, the representative [of the group]. 

Awa is 43 years old, married, and a mother of a girl who lives with her. 

With this loan, she is going to buy 500,000 francs worth of rice, oil, vegetables, meat, fish, and coffee. 

The earnings [from her business] will allow her to increase her savings and to help her husband with the family expenses, such as food and her daughter's school supplies.

loans.use: prepare food to resell

loans.name: Bissighin Wendwaogo Group

texts.fr:
Mr SALFO représente le groupe BISSIGHIN WEND WAOGA.  Il est marié, père de  01 enfant. Il est âgé de 18mois. Mr a 06 personnes a sa charge.
Mr  est couturier depuis 10ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché de Toecin. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes et les enfants.
Il veut s’acheter une machine à coudre et des vitres pour l’atelier.
Mr  veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de réinvestir dans son activité. Il  ambitionne mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. SALFO is the leader of BISSIGHIN WEND WAOGA Group. He's married and the father of one 18-month-old child. Mr. SALFO has six dependents.

He's been a tailor for ten years. He gets his supplies at the market in Toecin. His customers are women, men, and children. He wants to buy a sewing machine and window displays for his workshop.

Mr. SALFO wants to save his profits in order to reinvest in his business. He ambitions to take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and window displays

loans.name: Brenda Carolina

texts.es: Doña brenda de 55 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su hija, ella tiene un puesto de ventas de pupusas desde hace varios años en su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Doña brenda solicita un credito para poder comprar mesas y sillas, tambien para compra de materia como: quesillo, frijoles, chicharron, maiz y todo lo necesario para la elaboracion de las pupusas y asi pueda obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida con su hija.
texts.en: Brenda is 55 years old and lives in a rented house with her daughter. She has had a food stand selling pupusas, traditional El Salvadorian stuffed corn tortillas, outside her home for several years. With the profits she makes from this she is able to pay her household expenses. Brenda is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs, and ingredients such as cheese, beans, pork crackling, corn and everything else she needs to make pupusas, in order to boost her earnings and have a better life with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy cheese, beans, pork crackling, corn, tables, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Emprendedores De Vitarte Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  8   mujeres  emprendedoras   y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “ENPRENDEDORES DE VITARTE”. La Sra.
