Liliana  de 25 años de edad casada y sin hijos ,tiene una pequeño negocio de venta de ropa   ya hace unos 2 años. La Sra. Liliana ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus prendas de vestir ya sea para caballero y para damas y así obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en ampliar su local de venta de ropa  y así tener más variedades de ropa y  seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Liliana    y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado    y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Liliana  esta parada es la primera de la parte derecha   Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
A group comprised of eight women entrepreneurs with a lot of business creativity make up the communal bank "EMPRENDEDORES DE VITARTE".  Liliana, 25, is married and has no children.  For two years she has been running a small business selling clothing, and has been able to attract enough customers to generate an income to cover her household expenses.  In the future, she would like to have her own shop to sell both men's and women's apparel and earn even more income.

With the loan she plans to expand her clothing sales location.  Liliana and all the members of the group are grateful to Kiva for this loan and for all the confidence being shown them.  Liliana is the first one standing on the right.  She is committed to meeting all the goal she has set for herself.

loans.use: To expand her business location.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Jairo con su anterior credikiva compró acero, láminas galvanizadas, hierro, aluminio y pintura. Su credikiva lo benefició porque adquirió materias primas y aumentó la producción; con las utilidades generadas compró una máquina  dobladora y también generó dos empleos temporales, adicionalmente respondió a los compromisos con sus clientes y esto benefició positivamente su imagen. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará materiales como acero, hierro, aluminio, remaches, vidrios, cerraduras, cables y soldadura, pintura piedras para pulidoras etc. Todo esto preparándose para el futuro inmediato con una producción que impactará a sus clientes y también a sus ventas. 
Jairo envia un mensaje a sus finaciadoresde Kiva: "Su apoyo es muy importante, ya que con estos recursos he podido cumplir metas y mejorar en parte las condiciones de vida de mi familia. "
texts.en:
Jairo used his previous loan to buy steel, galvanized sheeting, iron, aluminum and paint.  The CrediKiva loan was of great benefit to him because he bought the raw materials he needed to increase production.  With the profits he earned he bought a bending machine and offered employment to two temporary workers.  He was also able to meet customer commitments which was very positive for his image.

He is now requesting a new CrediKiva loan to buy materials such as steel, iron, aluminum, nails, glass, locks, cables, welding materials, pain, stone for the polishers, etc.  His aim is to prepare for the immediate future in such a way as to impact his customers and increase sales.

Jairo sends the following messasge to Kiva lenders:  "Your support is very important because with these resources I have been able to meet my goals and improve my family's living conditions."

loans.use: To buy steel, iron, aluminum, nails, glass, locks, cables, welding materials, paint, stone for polishers, etc.

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es:
El señor José Noel tiene un taller de motores estacionarios de mecánica en el barrio santa ana desde hace 30 años, es casado tiene cuatro hijos  todos en edad escolar,  empezó su negocio con ahorro  propio. 

empieza su día de trabajo desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche si tiene bastante trabajo de lo contrario cierra a las cinco de la tarde.

 el señor José solicita el financiamiento para compra de repuestos para mantenerlos en su taller y así ofrecerles a sus clientes el producto  que ellos necesitan.
texts.en:
Mr. José Noel has had a mechanical workshop for stationary engines in the neighborhood of Santa Ana for thirty years. He is married and has four children that go to school. José started this business with his own savings.

José starts working at 05:00 am and works until 08:00 pm when necessary, otherwise he closes at 05:00 pm.

José is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to be able to offer his customers any product they might need.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his workshop.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor  José  de 47 años de edad  es casado y vive con su esposa se dedica al transporte de personas en lancha en la isla de Amapala su actividad la realiza  cinco días a la semana.
Don José  se dedica la actividad desde hace 10 años y sus clientes son todas las personas turistas que visitan la isla y en su gran mayoría son las personas que viven en  la isla que se transporta para salir hacia diferentes lugares del país.
Don José  también se dedica a la actividad de cria de cerdos y a la pesca esta el préstamo  para la compra de concentrado para cría de cerdos y una red de pescas. 
Don José  con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
Don José  su sueño es seguir sirviendo al público con su transporte.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Abril del 2013
texts.en:
José, 47, is married, lives with his wife and runs a passenger boat transport business on the island of Amapala five days a week.  He has been in business for ten years and his customers are all the tourists who visit the island as well as the people who live on the island and travel to other parts of the country.

José also raises pigs and is involved in fishing.  This loan is to buy animal feed and a fishing net.  With his profits and the help of the loan he hopes to get ahead and continue improving his income.

His greatest goal is to continue working in public transport.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - April, 2013

loans.use: To buy animal feed and a fishing net for his businesses.

loans.name: Leonor De La Paz

texts.es: Doña leonor de 44 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo en casa propia, ella tiene un puesto de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 23 años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Es una mujer luchadora que su empeño es dar lo mejor de si misma, para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Cuenta con la satisfacción de tener clientela fija ya que esta ubicado en un lugar muy transitado. La cliente desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y asi obtener mejores ganancias  para tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Leonor, 44, lives with her two children and her husband in her own house. She has had a food stall close to her home for 23 years. With the earnings from her sales, she manages to cover her household expenses. She is a fighter who is determined to give the very best of herself so that her family never lacks anything they need to survive. She has the satisfaction of having a fixed clientele, because the stall is located in a very busy area. 

She would like to expand her stall by buying tables, chairs, and more primary ingredients such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc. to diversify her menu and have a bit more financial income. However, she does not have the necessary income to make this investment. Therefore, she approached INTEGRAL to apply for a loan to buy these products, which will allow her to have better earnings and thus better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, rice, kitchen utensils, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel tiene 42 años de edad, vive en una casa que compro hace poco a lado de su esposa, y sus tres hijos.Daniel es Técnico en computación e informática, tiene un pequeño taller ubicado en su misma casa, donde ofrece sus servicios técnicos. Desde que termino su carrera, Daniel quiso ser independiente y es por eso que decidió trabajar por si solo, generar sus propios ingresos gracias a sus servicios.El principal problema que tuvo fue la falta de capital para empezar su negocio, pero como Daniel tiene una actividad complementaria además de técnico es docente, por eso empezó poco a poco a comprar sus cosas y fue implementado su negocio para que pueda desarrollar su actividad. Y fue así que gracias a su perseverancia y a su emprendimiento, que ahora cuenta con su negocio propio.Lo que Daniel espera de su trabajo es hacer crecer su pequeña empresa, para mejorar su calidad de vida, y ofrecer a sus hijos un mejor futuro.Este es el primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero recibido y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de S/.2000 comprara accesorios para computadoras.
texts.en:
Daniel is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house that he bought recently. Daniel is a computer and IT technician, and has a small workshop located is his home, in which he offers technical services. Since completing his degree, Daniel wanted to be independent and for this reason he decided to work for himself and make his own earnings from his services. His main problem was that he didn't have enough capital to start a business, but because Daniel also works as a teacher, he was able to gradually buy the items he needed and establish his business to develop his activity. In this way, thanks to his perseverance and endeavor, he now has his own business. 

Through his work, Daniel hopes to expand his small business, in order to improve his quality of life and offer his children a better future. This is his first loan with Kiva, he is grateful for the financial support offered and is committed to making his loan repayments on time. With the amount of S/.2000 he is requesting, he will buy computer accessories.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Maria de 52 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su hijo y su tio, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace 12 años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Maria solicita un credito para comprar maiz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia
texts.en:
Maria, 52, lives in a relative's home with her son and uncle.  For 12 years she has been selling tortillas from home, working Monday through Sunday.  She has many customers because she is a hard-working, kind person.  She uses her profits to cover household expenses.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy corn in bulk to continue making tortillas.  Her goal is to improve her earnings so her family has greater economic stability.

loans.use: To buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Leonardo De La Concepcion

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo  se dedica a la actividad de venta de productos ferreteros en el mercado de chinandega desde hace 40 años. 

Leonardo  es casado  con tres hijos ninguno de estos depende de él. se esfuerza por sacar adelante  a su hogar y a su esposa es por quien se esfuerza. en su negocio vende todo tipo de productos de ferreterías, vende de lunes a domingo desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde.

el financiamiento lo solicita para compra de mercadería para su negocio y así mantener sus ventas y ofrecerles a sus clientes variedad de mercadería.
texts.en:
Leonardo has made a living selling hardware goods in a market in Chinandega for forty years.

He is married with three children, none of whom is dependent on him. He works hard to provide for his household and for his wife, who is the reason he puts in so much effort. In his business, he sells all types of hardware products from Monday to Sunday, from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon.

He is applying for a loan to buy merchandise for his business, thus maintaining his sales and offering his clients a variety of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy hardware products, hammers, hoses, locks, power outlets, and extension cords.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 46 años de edad,tiene una casa propia donde vive acompañado de su esposa y dos hijos.Su actividad se centra en el comercio, tiene un local en el mercado donde vende ropa, telas y perfumería, hace 20 años que se dedica a este negocio siempre a lado de su esposa.Uno de los problemas que tuvo fue la falta de capital para poner su negocio,pero con el tiempo pudo ahorrar y poner su puesto de ventas. Gracias a la experiencia y al apoyo de su familia pudo salir adelante y establecerse en el mercado. Como un hombre emprendedor y responsable busca seguir creciendo y hacer crecer su pequeña empresa para tener que ofrecer mas a su familia.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero recibido, y como persona responsable promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado S/.1500 soles comprará ropa y telas al por mayor para incrementar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Juan, 46, has his own home where he lives with his wife and two children.  He is a merchant and has a stall at the market where he sells clothing, fabric and perfumes.  For 20 years he has been in business alongside his wife.  One of the problems he ran into was not having enough capital to start the business, but over time he was able to save and open his stall.

Thanks to his experience and the support of his family he was able to get ahead and establish himself in the market.  Being the responsible entrepreneur that he is, he is always looking for ways to grow and expand his small business so he can give more to his family.  This is his first Kiva loan, for which he is grateful, and he is committed to paying it back on time.

The 1,500 PEN loan will be used to buy clothing and fabrics wholesale to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy clothing and fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Flor, quien con su credikiva compró materias primas e insumos en un mayor volumen, ganando descuentos y pudiendo aumentar su producción de comidas, que vendió rápidamente.  Ella logró a su vez, remplazar los créditos a un alto costo que no le permitían ninguna ganancia. Desde que invirtió su crédito, también pudo remodelar la fachada de su negocio, arreglar la cocina,  porque ahora cuenta con más ingresos. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva lo siguiente: “Gracias por ayudarme a hacer crecer su negocio; estoy muy agradecida con Dios y ustedes por darme esta oportunidad.”  
En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará mas mesas, sillas, para adecuar el restaurante, también   necesita su crédito para comprar sacos de arroz, aceite, carnes, pollo, pescado, para la elaboración de comidas y almuerzos en un mayor volumen y con ello aumentar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Flor, who used her previous Kiva loan to buy primary materials and ingredients in greater quantities, earning discounts and increasing her food production, which she sold quickly. In turn, she was able to replace the high-cost loans that had not allowed her any profit. 

Since she invested her previous loan, she also remodeled the front of her business and fixed up the kitchen, because she now has a higher income. She says to her Kiva lenders: "Thank you for helping me to grow my business. I am very grateful to God and to you for giving me this opportunity."

She is now applying for another Kiva loan, which she will use to buy more tables and chairs to improve her restaurant. She also needs this loan to buy sacks of rice, oil, meat, chicken, and fish to make meals and snacks in greater quantities, thus increasing her family's income.

loans.use: to buy more tables and chairs to improve her restaurant and to buy sacks of rice, oil, meat, chicken, and fish.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Lidia  de 48  años de edad, tiene 03 hijos que dependen de ella, vive con sus hijos y su esposo en casa propia  ubicada en una comunidad San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña Blanca Lidia  se dedica desde hace 10 años  negocio de venta de ropa, su actividad la realiza de forma ambulante, sus clientes son los amigos, vecinos y personas que le visita de las fincas de camarón, cañeras, fincas de melón y sandia.
Doña Blanca está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de ropa nueva de señora como blusas, vestidos, faldas, pantalones,  calzonetas, etc. ya que se acerca el día de las madres y tiene varios pedidos.
Doña Blanca desea aprovechar la ocasión para tener mejores ganancias y con el apoyo del préstamo mejorar sus ingresos y que su negocio crezca un poco más. 
Doña Blanca su sueño es tener un buen negocio de ropa en su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Señora Blanca Lidia is 48 years old and has three children who are dependent on her. She lives with her children and husband in their own home in the town of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.
Blanca Lidia  has made a living over the past 10 years through a mobile business selling clothes. Her customers are her friends, neighbours, and people who visit her from shrimp, sugar cane, melon and watermelon farms.
Blanca is requesting a loan to buy new women's clothing such as blouses, dresses, skirts, trousers, shorts, and other items, since, because mother's day is coming, she has many orders. Blanca wants to make the most of this opportunity to boost her earnings and use the loan to increase her profits and expand her business a little.
Blanca's dream is to have a successful clothing store in her home. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras- April 2013

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, skirts, trousers, shorts and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Hugo Adelso

texts.es: Don hugo de 30 años de edad vive con su familia en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años su principal siembra es el maiz y el frijol con la ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Don Hugo solicita un crédito para poder comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. También para mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía que es donde siembra sus cosechas y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: Hugo is 30 years old and lives with his family in their own home. He has worked in agriculture for 10 years, and his main crops are maize and beans. He uses his earnings to pay the household expenses. Hugo is requesting a loan to buy compost, seeds, fertilizer, weedkillers, etc. He also wants to improve the plot of land shown in the photograph, which is where he grows his crops, and in this way make a better life for his family.

loans.use: to improve his land and buy seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Arlen Ramón

texts.es:
El Joven Arlen Ramón, es una persona  trabajadora y responsable, se desempeña como operador en una pequeña imprenta desde hace dos años, su estado civil es soltero, con una responsabilidad a su cargo de dos personas que depende de él.

 Solicita el  préstamo a ceprodel para comprar materiales de construcción tales como cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra, estos será invertido en repellar pared de su vivienda.

Con este financiamiento le servirá de mucha ayuda,
Ya que su ingreso son muy poco y ya que se le presenta esta oportunidad, le agradecería mucho.
texts.en:
Young Arlen Ramón is a responsible and hard-working person, who has worked as an operator in a small printing house for the past two years. He is single, and employs two people in his business.
He is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to buy building materials such as cement and sand, and to pay labourers, which will be used to plaster the walls of his home.
This loan will be very useful to him, because his earnings are low, and now that this opportunity has presented itself, he is extremely grateful.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Rene Alfonso

texts.es: Don rene de 41 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maiz y el frijol con la ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Don Rene solicita un crédito para poder comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. También para mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía  que es donde siembra sus cosechas y asi poder tener una mejora estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Rene is 41 years old. He lives with his wife and 5 children in a house he owns. He has worked in agriculture for several years. His main crop are corn and beans. With the income he obtains from his sales he is able to pay for his household expenses. Rene is asking for a loan to be able to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc., as well as to improve the sail on the land shown in the photograph. That is where he plants his crops. This way, he can have financial stability.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, fertilizers, and to improve the soil.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Amelia vive en Managua, se dedica arduamente a laborar como sub-directora, dedicándose a esta labor en un centro escolar desde hace diecisiete años, es casada con 3 hijos a quienes les está brindando el apoyo para su desarrollo académico.
 
Una de las necesidades que la señora Amelia atraviesa hoy en día es de mejorar su vivienda con el anexo de cuartos y cocina, lo que le permitió tomar la decisión de solicitar un crédito a ceprodel para la compra de bloque, cemento, varilla de hierro, piedrín , arena,  y mano de obra, de esta manera mejorar las condiciones familiares, efectuando este gran esfuerzo que es la única manera para lograr el objetivo a través del financiamiento oportuno.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amelia lives in Managua. She has worked hard as sub-principal in a school for seventeen years. She is married and has three children. She supports them with their education.

Mrs. Amelia needs to improve her house with the construction of two annexes: the bedrooms and the kitchen. She decided to request a loan to CEPRODEL to buy bricks, cement, iron bars, gravel and sand, and to pay for the labor. This way, she hopes to improve her family’s living conditions. This is a great effort, but it is the only way to reach her goals: through a timely financing.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan Carlos, trabaja en actividades de diseño grafico en una empresa de imprenta. De ahí proviene su fuente de ingresos. Vive en un municipio de Managua con su familia. 
     
Solicita el  préstamo a ceprodel para invertir en  la reparación de su casa, lo cual será reforzamiento de paredes y reparación de techo, con este crédito comprara bloque, hierro, cinz. Estas mejoras le permitirán reparar su vivienda.

 Agradece  a  Ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en el, por lo que este crédito lo invertirá en su vivienda de forma que esto le permitirá ir mejorando su condición de vida y la de su familia al mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos works in graphic design in a printing company. That is his source of income. He lives in the city of Managua with his family.   
     
He is asking for the loan from Ceprodel to invest in home repair. This will be reenforcing the walls and repairing the roof. With this loan, he will buy blocks, iron rods, and zinc sheeting. These improvements will allow him to repair his home.

He is grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva for the opportunity and the trust they have put in him. He will invest this loan in his home, allowing him to improve his and his family's quality of life by improving their home.

loans.use: to do home improvement and buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrate for chickens.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in the Likoni area of theCoast Province in Kenya. She is a married business lady and owns a farming business. She keeps poultry. Besides this, she is also employed. The business has been running for three years. Susan has one child in school.

Susan learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is the harsh climate and price fluctuations. She is applying for a loan of 85,050 Kenyan shillings to buy more chickens to sell. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to purchase more inventory. Her desire is also to keep egg laying chickens in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
After graduating junior high school, Georgina decided to set up her own food vendor business in Yabiw (near Cape Coast). With over 10 years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. 

As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more ingredients to make food to sell. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband, a taxi driver, with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Nimote

texts.en:
Nimote has been a merchant for more than 10 years. She has a store and butcher shop at the market in Mwambalazi. She is a widow and has seven children. All of them are adults now and independent.

She says she started at the bottom and had to suffer a lot to get ahead. She's requesting this loan to invest in buying animals to butcher and sell in her butcher shop. This way she'll be able to continue filling her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy animals to butcher and sell in her shop.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a very hardworking and responsible person with more than 20 years of experience in this area. Thanks to her job, her family is getting ahead and they have everything they need. She's requesting another Kiva loan to invest in another business buying goats so she can continue to grow. She's grateful for this opportunity because it will help her grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ngula

texts.en:
Ngula is 46 years old and from Mwambalazi. She lives with her partner, who is a farmer. They live in their own home and have two children, all of whom attend school. 

Ngula has run a store for over 10 years. It is going very well, because she says that she has a loyal customer base thanks to her excellent service, in addition to being the best-stocked store in the neighborhood. This combination of factors means that she is enjoying lots of success. 

She dreams of being able to continue to grow, so that she earns enough to help her husband with the household expenses. She is requesting this loan to buy drinks, sugar, rice, flour and other items, as these are the best-selling products. She is grateful for the help she is receiving. It will be very useful.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar, rice, flour and other products to sell.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a small-scale plastic containers vendor in Yabiw (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a primary school graduate. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Cynthia has been working as a plastics saleswoman for close to three years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of plastic containers, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of plastic containers

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Thanks to the work that she is doing, Teresia is educating her children and buys all of the daily household necessities.

Teresia is asking for this loan to buy construction materials for her projects, since with it she will have a good stock of them in order to be able to continue providing good service to her customers. She is grateful for the help she is receiving, since it will be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Его зовут Абдучаббор. Ему 31 года. Он женат на доброй женщине, которую зовут Рухсора и на воспитании имеет 2  детей. Так как он живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Он более 2 года занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Данное время он имеет 3 коровы. Дополнительно он занимается купле продажей фруктов. Он хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. С полученного дохода он планирует улучшить условию проживания. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1200 долларов США для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Here is a person who has always tried to improve his living conditions, and hopes for a bright future, and is in need of financial support. His name is Abdujabbor. He is 31, married to a fine woman named Rukhsora, and is raising 2 children. Because he lives in a rural area, he has a good opportunity to expand his livestock business. He has been involved in livestock for more than two years, and has a lot of experience in this type of business. Thanks to the high quality of his animals, he has permanent customers. Right now he has three cows; he also sells fruit. He wants to develop his business and earn more income. He plans to use the additional income to improve his living conditions. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 US dollars to buy livestock. He awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Ozada

texts.ru: Озада замужем и у нее трое сыновей. Ей 39 лет. Она со своей семьей живет в юго-западной части Таджикистана в районе Шахритус. У Озады среднее образование. Она занимается торговлей на рынке своего района. Одновременно Озада хочет начать животноводческую деятельность, а именно заняться купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. При дворе ее дома имеется сарай для содержания скота. К тому же климат района благоприятствует здесь разведению скота. Озада берет кредит для закупа 5-голов бычков с целью дальнейшего откорма и перепродажи.
texts.en: Ozada is 39, married and has three sons.  She lives with her family in Shahrituz, in southwestern Tajikistan. She has a high school education. She works as a merchant at the local market. But Ozada wants to start a livestock business; in particular, selling cattle. She has a large shed in her yard for housing the animals. Moreover, the local climate is favorable for raising livestock. Ozada is requesting a loan to buy 5 bulls with the goal of fattening and reselling them later on.

loans.use: to buy 5 bulls with the goal of fattening and reselling them.

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Mena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling beverages in Yabiw (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 30 years. Mena is married and has nine children. Her husband is currently retired. As the sole breadwinner in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. 

Mena wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of beverages. In the long term, Mena plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Agya

texts.en:
Agya is divorced and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Agya is a successful businesswoman. She sells groceries in Yabiw (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about four years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Agya uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Agya will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of groceries to sell, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agya plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of groceries to sell

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta  de 55  años de edad, tiene 02 hijos que dependen de ella, vive con sus hijos, en casa propia,  vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Jacinta se dedica desde hace 15 años  negocio de venta de ropa su actividad la realiza de forma ambulante y tiene dos personas que le venden la mercadería, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que son clientes de hace muchos años.
Doña Jacinta es una persona muy trabajadora y con deseos de casar adelante a su familia, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de ropa nueva como pantalones, vestidos, faldas, blusas, camisas, calzonetas, etc. ya que se acerca el día de las madres y tiene varios pedidos que desea cubrir.
Doña Jacinta espera que mejore un poco su condición económica su sueño es tener surtido bien su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Jacinta is fifty-five years old and has two children that are dependent on her.  She lives with her children in her own house in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras.

Jacinta has made a living for fifteen years in the business of selling clothing.  She sells door to door and has two people that sell her the merchandise.  Her customer base is made up of friends and other individuals who have been her clients for many years.  Jacinta is a very hardworking person with dreams to move ahead with her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy new clothing, like pants, dresses, skirts, blouses, shirts, bathing suits, etc.  Mother's Day is coming and she has many orders that she would like to fill.  Jacinta hopes that her economic condition will improve a little.  Her dream is to have her business well-stocked.

San Lorenzo, Hondras - April 2013

loans.use: to buy pants, dresses, skirts, blouses, shirts, bathing suits, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоил добросовестный, целеустремленный и очень трудолюбивый человек. Он уже 11 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур и скотоводством, дети и жена помогают ему в этом. Старший сын ездить в Российcкую Федерацию и там он  зарабатывает и отправляет деньги домой, чтобы  кормит  семью и для продолжение бизнеса отца. Они живут в старом домике. Исмоил уже несколько лет старается построить новый дом, но из- за не хватки денег он не смог. Данный момент сын вырос, скоро Исмоилу придется провести свадебное торжество своего сына. Но с начала им надо будет, построить хороший дом, который дальнейшим будет жить сын и невестка. Конечно, его сын в этом году тоже ездил в Российскую Федерацию, но все равно те деньги, который он отправил отцу, не хватает на постройки дома. У них есть скот, жена Исмоила продает кефир и молоко на местном рынке. Исмоил обратился с целью получение займа для постройки дома, и он очень надеется на Ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ismoil is an honest, purposeful, and very hardworking person. For eleven years, he has been farming and raising livestock. His wife and children help him. His oldest son has gone to the Russian Federation for work; he will earn money there and send it home to feed the family and help his father continue his business. They live in an old house. Ismoil has been wanting to build a new house for several years, but has been unable to due to a lack of money. Now his son is grown, and Ismoil will soon host a wedding celebration for him. But first they need to build a good house for his son and daughter-in-law to live in. Of course his son also left for Russia this year, but the money he has sent to his father is not enough to build a house. They have some livestock animals, and Ismoil's wife sells kefir and milk at the local market. Ismoil has requested a loan to build a new house, and he is very eagerly awaiting your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy building materials to build a new house for his son

loans.name: Gaviotas Del Sur Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento Gaviotas del Sur tiene  está  compuesto por ocho  integrantes todas mujeres,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Shirley tiene 37 años, y dos hijos  que son de las edades de 5 y 12 años, la Sra.  Shirley se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad Santa Cruz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Shirley va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético y joyas por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra.  Shirley va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra.  Shirley es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Gaviotas del Sur [Seagulls of the South] is made up of eight members, all women.  The president of this group is Shirley.  She is thirty-seven years old and has two children, ages 5 and 12.  Shirley makes a living in selling cosmetics through a catalog.  She sells her products door to door, visiting homes and public and private offices in the city of Santa Cruz, where she offers her products.

This loan is her first sequence within the institution.  Shirley is going to use this loan to purchase cosmetics and jewelry wholesale; there is a current promotion.  In this way, she will offer a variety of products to her customers and increase her profits.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business; Shirley will use the benefits to continue buying a variety of beauty products.

Shirley is a very hardworking person.  She feels happy for the opportunity offered to her and her group members, since in some cases, they are the only ones that maintain their families.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and jewelry wholesale.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married mother of five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mishi has operated a maize retail shop for the past six years, selling maize to her neighbors. The major business challenge she faces is seasonality. Mishi dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Nevys Johanna

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Nevys quien con su credikiva   compró víveres como arroz azúcar, panela, pastas alimenticias, refrescos verduras, lácteos etc. Sus ventas se incrementaron porque ofreció precios cómodos a sus clientes. Su negocio tiene ahora un mayor surtido porque su clientela visita frecuentemente más su tienda. Nevys pide  a los financiadores de Kiva que sigan apoyando a la juventud que tiene ganas  salir adelante en la vida y cumplir sus metas y objetivos. “En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará víveres, enlatados, lácteos productos de aseo y para el hogar. Con ello estará nuevamente más surtida su tienda y su oferta, será cada vez más apetecida por su clientela, impactando así su demanda.
texts.en:
Thanks for supporting Nevys who purchased provisions such as rice, sugar, whole cane sugar, pasta, soft drinks, dairy products, etc.  with her Kiva loan. Her sales increased because she was able to offer good value to her customers. Now her business has a wider range of products resulting in her customers shopping at her store more often. 

Nevys is asking Kiva financers to continue supporting young people who are eager to get on well in life and to achieve their aims and objectives. She is employing her Kiva loan at the moment, using it to buy provisions, for example tinned goods, dairy products and toilet and household cleaning products. In this way her store will be restocked and she will be able to offer her customers a more attractive range of goods, which will improve demand.

loans.use: to buy provisions, such as tinned goods, dairy products, and toilet and household cleaning products

loans.name: Wend Songda Group

texts.fr:
Mme  S. AUGUSTINE est responsable du groupe WENDSONGDA. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 16 ans et le moins âgés à 12 ans. 02 vont  à l’école.
Mme vend du dolo ( boisson local) depuis 05ans.  Elle s’approvisionne à Tampouy. Ses clients sont les  femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter  02sacs de sorgho et 04tas de bois de chauffe pour la préparation du dolo (boisson local).	
Elle veut  épargner  ses bénéfices afin de réinvestir dans son activité. Mme  ambitionne  agrandir son activité et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. AUGUSTINE is the leader of the WENDSONGDA group. She is the married mother of three children aged 12 to 16, two of whom go to school.

She has been selling a local beverage called "dolo" for five years. She buys her supplies in Tampouy, and her customer base consists of women.

She plans to buy 2 bags of sorghum and four piles of firewood to prepare the dolo. 

She wants to save her profits to reinvest in her activity. Her goal is to expand her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of sorghum and four piles of firewood to prepare dolo.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma 37, is a widow with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past 15 years, Fatuma has operated a business buying and selling goats and cows for meat sale at the market to local neighbors and butchers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan, Fatuma wants to purchase goats and one cow for meat sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and one cow for meat sale.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Ester did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ester sells saucepans and bowls in Yabiw (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 5 years. As a single divorcee with 3 children, Ester uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Ester will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of saucepans and bowls, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ester wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of saucepans and bowls.

loans.name: Makanga

texts.en:
Makanga comes from Mwambalazi. He is 30 years old and works in his internet cafe. 

Makanga tells us that he has made the sacrifice to work in a very difficult industry for two years, but thanks to the help of his parents, he was able to open an internet cafe, which gives him some extra income to put towards the household bills. Makanga's dream is to continue expanding his business, which is why he has applied for a loan from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance to pay for the maintenance of the computers in his internet cafe so that he can offer the best possible service to his customers.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the computers in his internet cafe.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
She sells food, helped by her family. Her first loan was very beneficial for her, since she was able to buy vegetables and grains for sale. Before this, she did not have enough capital to work with and the loan came when she needed it the most. She has paid the installments on time.

She always struggles to improve her food stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Angelica is requesting a loan to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables and food packaging.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables and food packaging.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman who is 45 years old. She lives in the village of Miti with her husband and 12 children. Out of those 12, eight are still attending different schools in Rakai. She also takes care of two granddaughters who lost their mother (her daughter).

Agnes is a farmer who deals in agriculture, specifically tomatoes and maize. She works six days a week and eight hours each day. She also makes local brews and keeps animals such as goats and pigs but on a very small scale.

Agnes started growing tomatoes in 1993. Since then, this has been her major source of income. She started growing tomatoes in order to earn a living and develop her income. Through this trade, she has managed to educate her children.

Agnes has acquired UGX 1,000,000 in order to buy fertilizers for her maize plantation and pesticides for the tomato plantation.

She sells her produce to different traders from Kyotera and maize to different schools around her area.

Her dream is to be the leading supplier of agricultural products in her area. However, she faces the problem of price fluctuations for her products.

Agnes describes herself as a hardworking lady and encourages lenders to always give services to their clients.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her tomato garden

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: After graduating from junior high school, Grace decided to set up her own grocery store in Yabiw (near Cape Coast). With over five years’ of experience, she is looking to expand her enterprise. Unfortunately, she is limited by a lack of funding. This loan will be used to help her buy more groceries for resale. She aims to use the profits from her business to help her husband (who is a security guard) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Fante

texts.en: Even though Fante grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Fante is an entrepreneur. She sells palm oil in Yabiw (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 20 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their five children. Fante has identified growing demand among her customers for her product. She is unable to meet their needs because of her limited inventory. She aims to use her loan to buy more palm fruit. With the new profit from her expanded business, Fante wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to put further distance between their family and poverty.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruit for her palm oil business.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umazi is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is for food for the family. For the past ten years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation. With the loan she is applying for, of KES 30,000, she wants to buy 20 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mary  Ekua

texts.en: Mary is a widow and has four children. After successfully graduating from middle school, Mary has become an established businesswoman. She sells saucepans in Yabiw (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about five years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Mary uses her income to provide for the entire family. Mary will use the loan to buy more saucepans to sell, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, thus adapting to her customers’ changing preferences.

loans.use: to buy more saucepans for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and together with her husband they have four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 2 years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling at wholesale to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in the business. Mwanamisi dreams of establishing a vegetable stall in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Uba

texts.en:
Uba is a married woman with five kids. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a Kiosk business, selling from home where her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Uba dreams of establishing a wholesale shop business in the future. 

With the loan of Kshs 50,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Rashidatu

texts.en:
Even though Rashidatu grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Rashidatu is an entrepreneur. She sells groceries in Yabiw (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 10 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their child. 

Rashidatu has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her products. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more groceries to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she wants to buck the trend by ensuring that her child will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a very hardworking person who makes an effort every day from very early in the morning when she begins her work day.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy fruits, vegetables and coconuts so she can continue working and giving her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is a married woman blessed with nine children, six of whom still attend school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For over ten years, Mose has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She also operates a farming business which earns her another source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With this loan, Mose wants to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman who has two school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mwanajuma operates a business selling paraffin for cooking to neighbors. She also operates a retail shop, which enables her to earn another source of income. The major business challenge she faces is the high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase 10 liters of paraffin for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 liters of paraffin for resale.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: She would like to expand her business and to have another shop in the outskirts of town near the wholesale market, since her products are in high demand with her customers. Mejumaa is applying for another Kiva loan so she can buy more fish, since they are in high demand, and she would like to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her shop.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbors and town dwellers are her potential customers. She faces the major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, leading to losses because of her perishable goods. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, cooking fat and both maize flour and wheat flour. She dreams of expanding to a modern café with her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, cooking fat and both maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman and a mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Asha has operated a coconut vending business for the past thirteen years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Asha dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en:
Mwikali has been operating a retail shop. Thanks to the good variety she offers, she has been able to establish a good clientele. She is a hardworking individual and says that she wants to continue growing in her current profession. For this reason, she strives to do her best.

Mwikali is requesting another Kiva loan so that she can invest in the purchase of beverages, milk, bread, noodles, rice, vegetables and other products so that she can continue offering her customers the variety that they are accustomed to having.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, milk, bread, noodles, rice, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en:
Father of three children, Vahagn lives in Tsovagyugh village which is in Sevan area. Vahagn is 30 years old and he graduated from Armenian State Agrarian University. He has never worked by his profession. 

Vahagn, together with his wife, is engaged in farming and animal breeding. The only source of income of Vahagn's family is farming. They work hard day and night in order to sustain their big family. Vahagn has cows, bulls, sheep and chickens in his farm. Products from animal breeding are sold in Sevan food markets.

Also Vahagn raises vegetables in his plot of land which is near their house. Vahagn says that his wife helps him s lot and he couldn't overcome his problems and difficulties without his wife's help. They are a young, big family and they hope to create a good future for their children and for that aim they will do their very best.

For increasing animal breeding, Vahagn needs a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy three calves and fodder for his animals. Vahagn hopes to enlarge his farming business and receive a good profit.

loans.use: To buy three calves and fodder for his animals

loans.name: Anyuta

texts.en:
Anyuta is a 59-year-old business lady. Anyuta lives with her husband and son in Vanadzor city. She graduated from Gyumri State Polytechnic Institute at the Department of Light Industry Technologies. For a long time Anyuta worked in a knitting factory as an accountant, but as the salary was low she decided to run her own business in Vanadzor. 

For more than 10 years, Anyuta has been engaged in food trading business. She sold her goods in a little store which she built out of the profit from trading near their house. Anyuta sells food; vegetable oil, butter, juices, mineral water, canned food, sweets, bread, meat, dairy products and so on.

During 10 years of hard work,  Anyuta has received a good repute and a lot of clients from her living area and neighboring areas of Vanadzor city. Customers prefer to buy food from Anyuta’s store because there you can find only fresh and good quality products. Anyuta’s son helps her in the trading business and transports goods from Yerevan wholesale markets to their store in Vanadzor city. 

Anyuta decided to open a household goods section in her shop and for this she is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to repair the household goods section of her shop and buy a lot of household goods from Yerevan wholesale markets for resale in her shop. This way she hopes to add to the number of her clients and to receive more profit from her business.

loans.use: To repair the household goods section of her shop and buy lots of household goods from Yerevan wholesale markets

loans.name: Che

texts.en:
Che, a married father of six, lives with his family in a four-bedroom apartment house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. Among the challenges he has faced are inadequate finance for his business and the deaths of his father, two of his children in childbirth, his mother and kid sister.

With the loan requested, Che will buy piglets, chicks and feed for the expansion of his poultry farm, as well as stones for resale which will be used by the community for the building of houses. He is positive this business will succeed because he is determined and will put in all the effort needed. Che has regular customers who will buy his piglets and chicks, and the demand for stones is very high. The community will benefit from the droppings which will serve as manure, and the chicks and piglets will be used in the community for ceremonial activities.

With the profit from the loan, Che will educate his children and the children of his late kid sister and expand his business. He prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy chicks, piglets, feeds and stones.

loans.name: Samin

texts.en:
Samin says that her store is a big help in the financial support of her home. Through this work, she has been able to educate her children and give them what they need. She says that her dream is to have a larger commercial facility so she can obtain more customers and increase her earnings.

Samin is asking for another loan in order to invest in the purchase of fruit, vegetables, groceries and other supplies in order to continue selling and providing her customers with what they are looking for.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, vegetables, groceries and other supplies.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Dorcas did not have access to any formal education. However, this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Dorcas sells groceries in Yabiw (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 10 years. She is married to a contractor, and together they have five children. 

Dorcas uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Dorcas will use the loan to purchase groceries, which will aid in improving her overall sales. Dorcas wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi's a person with a lot of enthusiasm who likes to get ahead. That's why she works so hard. She works from very early in the morning to prepare the dishes she sells, and she returns home late at night.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy beverages and supplies for her dishes. This is what she most needs and uses every day. Mwanamisi's grateful for this opportunity because with it she's making progress.

loans.use: to buy beverages and supplies for her dishes.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a married woman and lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

For over two years, Serah has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also operates a farming business which earns her another source of income. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With this loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feeds.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Tafor

texts.en:
She is married and a mother of five, two of them below the age of fifteen. They all live in a three-room apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced some challenges in life among which are sickness, inadequate finances to carry out her business, unwanted pregnancy, early marriage, school dropout, theft, and loss of pigs due to sickness.

With the new loan requested, she will expand her business by buying more vegetable in bags and Irish potatoes in bags. She will also buy two pigs. She will use part of the loan to buy feed for the pigs, and part of the loan will be invested in farm work. This business will succeed because she has been doing it for a long time and as such has experience. She has a good business site, and she has steady customers who buy her products. With the business, the community will buy household food items at cheaper prices.

With the profit from this loan, she will take care of the family hospital bills; she will educate her children, provide better meals for the family, expand her business and save some in order to undertake bigger investments. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, Irish potatoes, pigs, feed for them, and invest in farm work.

loans.name: Lum

texts.en:
Lum is married with seven children, and they live in a two-bedroom apartment house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate finances to carry out her business, unwanted pregnancy, early marriage, dropping out of school and theft.

With the new loan she has requested, she will expand her business by buying more plastic drainers, cups, buckets, bowls, carrots, green beans, cabbages and tomatoes. She is positive this business will succeed because she has been doing it for over six years and has experience. She has a good business site, and she has steady customers who buy her products. At the business, the community will buy household items at cheaper prices.

With the profit from this loan, she will educate her children, provide three square meal to them on a daily basis, expand her business and save some in order to undertake bigger investments. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy plastic cups, buckets, bowls, drainers, carrots, green beans, cabbages and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 53 years old. She lives alone in Vanadzor city. Anahit has achieved higher education; she is a Philologist (a discipline that includes literary studies, history and linguistics). 

Anahit is a teacher with more than 30 years of work experience. Now in parallel with teaching the Armenian language and literature, Anahit is a school administrator in Vanadzor. She has a perfect reputation and many parents want to send their school-aged children to Anahit for teaching. 

As her teacher salary is low, after school Anahit organizes lessons and private teaching courses in her house. She constructed one room in her home as a classroom and teaches students and prepares them for examinations for university.
 
Anahit needs a loan amount of 300,000 Armenian drams to buy a new computer for organizing the educational process in her home for more quality. She says that without a computer, it is too hard in our century.

loans.use: To buy a new computer for organizing the teaching process in her home.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
She is married with four children and they all live in a two-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate finances to carry out her business, the death of her father, brother, and mother because of inadequate finances to cater for medication, and ill health of her child.

With this new loan, she will expand her foodstuff sales by buying more palm oil, Irish potatoes, maize, beans, groundnut oil, garlic and onions. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has a good business site, she has regular customers who buy from her, she sells a variety of goods, has experience in the business, and she already has suppliers who supply the goods to her on time if there is demand. 

With this business activity, the community will have a regular supply of foodstuff, and she will also sell at discount prices since she buys from the suppliers in large quantities. With the profit from the loan, she will educate her children, provide three square meals to her family, and build a house. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, Irish potatoes, maize, beans, groundnut oil, garlic and onions

loans.name: Nche

texts.en:
Nche, a married father of seven, lives with his family in a five-bedroom apartment house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced many challenges in life including inadequate finance for his business, the death of family members, problems with one of his sons, and an accident with a gun at a death celebration that led to severe wounds on his hand.

With the requested loan, Nche will buy farm seedlings for yams, maize, beans, and cassava. He is very positive his business will succeed because he has been a farmer for many years and knows all the techniques for ensuring a good yield, and he will plant the seedlings in fertile land. With this business activity, the community will have a supply of foods at all times; people will not need to travel far distances to buy food since he will sell to them at reduced prices.

With the profit from the loan, Nche will educate his children, provide them with three square meals a day, and reinvest some of the profit into his business. He prefers GHAPE loans because of convenient repayment intervals and the fact that the members are taught business management skills before the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: To buy farm seedlings of yams, maize, beans, and cassava.

loans.name: Bonghaseh

texts.en:
Bonghaseh is married with no children. He lives in a one-bedroom house in Bamenda in the Northwest Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate finances to carry out his business, the death of his mother and his elder brother’s son who was living with him, loss of property due to theft, unemployment, poverty in his family and the sickness of his wife.

With this loan he requested, he will repair his motorbike by buying a new battery, two new tires, an engine, side covers and a cylinder. With this activity, the business will succeed because he has been suffering for a while now because of rampant failure of his bike since all the parts are worn out. After buying these parts, the machine will work without problems; thus, he will carry many passengers. With this business activity, the community will benefit from easy movement since he will transport them to their various destinations at cheaper rates, and also drop students at schools.

With the profit from the loan, he will open a small provision store for his wife in his neighborhood and also save against further depression of the bike. He prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy a battery, tires, an engine, a cylinder and side cover for his worn-out motorbike.

loans.name: Abner José

texts.es:
Condega  un municipio que está ubicado en la parte norte del departamento de Estelí, conocido como tierra de alfareros por su artesanía y gente trabajadora. 

Vive el señor Abner José  en una comunidad aledaña hacia la zona este, con su esposa y su hijo al que tiene el deber de mantener y darles sus estudios, su profesión es la agricultura, se dedica a la  siembra de granos básicos maíz y frijoles  y la ganadería en una pequeña escala.

Conocido como una persona honesta y trabajadora tiene una propiedad de 10 manzanas de extensión con diferentes tipos de aéreas para la explotación agrícola y ganadera.

Recientemente visitó la  oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar  un crédito para preparación de terreno para la siembra de primera y comprar abono, herbicida y fungicida  más gastos de mano de obra, donde piensa salir beneficiado y darle el mantenimiento correspondiente  a sus cultivos maíz y frijoles.
 
El lleva créditos anteriores los cuales ha repagado en tiempo y forma. El impacto y beneficios que tiene él y su familia son de una forma positiva ya que trabajan  su finca a través de siembras agrícolas en cada ciclo,  mejorando su nivel de vida y condiciones económicas con los ingresos obtenidos en cada cosecha realizada.
texts.en:
Condega, a municipality located in the northern section of Estelí department, is renowned for its potters, handicrafts and for its hard-working population. Abner José lives with his wife and son in a village in the eastern section of the municipality. He is responsible for supporting his son and ensuring that he receives an education. 

He is a farmer that cultivates corn and beans and that also operates small-scale cattle ranching. Known as an honest and hard-working individual, Abner José owns a property of roughly 17.5 acres [10 manzanas] that is divided into sections for agriculture and cattle ranching.  

He recently visited Ceprodel's offices to request a loan to prepare his fields for the first planting; to buy manure, herbicide and fungicide, and to cover the expenses of manual labour. He hopes to do well and to give his crops of corn and beans the maintenance they require. 

He has taken out loans previously and has repaid them on time.  The loan will have a positive impact on him and his family as they work on the farm, planting crops during each agricultural cycle. The income they earn from each harvest helps to improve their quality of living and their economic well-being.

loans.use: to purchase supplies: manure, herbicide and fungicide.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married with four children, and they all live in a three-bedroom apartment house in the Bamenda Mezam division of the Northwest Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate finances to carry out his business, the death of his sister, the suffering from poverty in his family, and sickness.

With the new loan he has requested, he will buy farm seedlings such as yams, maize, beans and cassava for planting in his farmland in his compound. He will also buy fertilizer, manure, chemicals, chicks and feed for the chicks. He holds a positive view for the success of his business because he has been involved in farming for many years now, his farmland is very fertile, and he plans to buy good seedlings. He has already customers who will buy his chicks. With this farming activity, the community will benefit from some of the animal droppings, which will serve as manure for their farms; the farm output will be sold to the community at moderate prices. 

With the profit from this loan, he will educate his children and expand his business. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the low interest rate and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy farm seedlings, fertilizer, chemicals, feed and chicks.

loans.name: Ambo

texts.en:
Ambo is a widow with three children, and they live in a two-bedroom apartment house in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the Northwest Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are sickness in her family, the death of family members (most especially her father, mother, brothers and husband, who were of great support to her financially, morally and materially) and inadequate capital to operate her business.


With this new loan she requested, she will invest in the growing of mushrooms in her compound. She is positive toward the success of this business because she has attended training where she was drilled on the preservation and production of mushrooms, and she has a good site. With this activity, the community will have mushrooms all year round for consumption, which will provide their bodies with calcium.

With the profit from this loan, she will save some for future expansion, pay for her children's education and provide her family with three square meals a day. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy mushrooms for growing in her compound.

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Kristina is a young accountant. She is 30 years old and lives with her pensioner mother in Vanadzor city.

Kristina graduated from Vanadzor State Agricultural College's department of accounting and audit. She used to work in Vanadzor’s various educational institutions as an accountant. Since 2007, Kristina has worked in Vanadzor’s school as an accountant, but as her salary is so low, she takes accounting reports by order and makes accounting services to various organizations. It gives her a good monthly income. Kristina is the only breadwinner in her family, and she must work hard day and night in order to meet her family's needs and care for her mother.

Kristina needs a loan to buy a computer and printer, which will help her to make her accounting reports faster and more effectively, and she will save more time for caring for her mother.

loans.use: To buy a computer and printer for her accounting business.

loans.name: Mariela Elizabeth

texts.es:
La clienta Mariela vive en Libertad. Debido a su situación que tiene un bebe tuvo que buscar la manera  de crear ingresos y de esa manera vio en la venta de ropa  la posibilidad de tener un negocio propio.

Trabaja todos los días en la mañana y en  la tarde.  Su dificultad es su enfermedad. No es casada, tiene una nena que estudia en escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo va a comprar tela y ropa. Su sueño es tener un local donde pueda vender su ropa ya que ella también las elabora para mejorar su ingreso y hacer su casa de cemento.
texts.en:
Mariela lives in Libertad.  Because she has a baby, she had to look for a way to create income.  This is how she saw that selling clothes was a possibility to having her own business.

She works every day in the mornings and the afternoons.  Her difficulty is her illness.  She is not married, and she has a little girl who attends public school.

She will use the loan to buy fabric and clothes.

Her dream is to have a place where she would be able to sell clothes.  She also makes clothes in order to improve her income and to build her house from cement.

loans.use: to buy fabric and clothes.

loans.name: Renaissance Group

texts.fr:
Mme LEONIE est la responsable du groupe RENAISSANCE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 08ans. Les 03 vont à l’école.
Mme vend des céréales depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter 03 sacs de mil, 01sac d’haricot et 04sacs de maïs.
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices.  Mme ambitionne s’acheter un motocycle et étendre les limites de son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. LEONIE represents the group RENAISSANCE. She is doing well. She is the married mother of three children aged 8 to 18 who all attend school. 

LEONIE has been selling cereals for eleven years. She buys her stock in neighboring villages. Her customer base consists of both women and men. 

Leonie plans to buy three sacks of millet, one sack of beans and four sacks of maize. She wants to save her profits. Her goal is to buy an motorcycle and expand her business territory.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of millet, one sack of beans and four sacks of maize.

loans.name: Sababougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Mme AZILA JUDITH  représente le  groupe  SABABOUGNOUMA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère d’un enfant. Il est  âgé de 03 ans. L’enfant ne va à l’école et elle a 03 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend du combustible depuis 10ans.  Elle s’approvisionne par livraison à domicile. Ses clients sont les habitants du quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter  une rangé de combustible.	
Elle  veut  renforcer  son activité avec ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne  dans l’avenir ouvrir un kiosque et mieux s’occuper  de son enfant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Azila Judith is the leader of the Sababougnouma group. She is doing well. She is the married mother of a 3-year-old child who does not yet go to school. She supports three people.

Mrs. Azila Judith has been selling fuel for ten years. She gets her supplies delivered to her home. Her customers are locals.

She would like to buy a range of fuel products. She will use her profits to strengthen her business. Her goal is to open a kiosk and better provide for her child.

loans.use: to buy a range of fuel products.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 33-year-old hardworking man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.
